Job Title: Middle Tier & Database Administrator Oracle SaaS at Customer Cloud Operations
Job Description:
Description

SHIFT:

SCHEDULE:

Responsible for the operation of production environments, including systems and databases, supporting critical business operations. Will perform administration and analysis for multiple production environments and recommend new and novel solutions to improve availability, performance, and supportability. This is an opportunity to bring a combination of deep technical knowledge with administration/analysis knowledge of Oracle's Cloud Infrastructure to provide escalation support to a wide range of complex production environment problems related to immense growth, scaling, leveraging the cloud, extremely high performance, and high availability requirements.

Install, monitor, maintain, support, and optimize all production server hardware and software. Provide escalated technical support for complex technical issues which may include leading problem management cases and providing management status. Coordinate escalated support cases and lead appropriate internal technical resources and/or third party vendors to resolution and coordinate a storage infrastructure of Oracle system and database appliances. Responsible for Oracle production environments; assist with server operating system and application upgrades, bug fixes, and patching; and work on standardization projects for both hardware and software under the Oracle technology stack while providing consistent system uptime as expected in a Cloud environment. Provide on-call support, on a rotating basis.

BS degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or equivalent work experience. Identifies and implements complex solutions in Technical Infrastructure support and server administration in a mid-sized environment; supporting and troubleshooting distributed applications, software, and operating systems; and administering and troubleshooting issues with messaging middleware and message brokers. Knowledge of enterprise platforms. Desire to keep up with modern technology and make recommendations. Knowledge of network architecture and protocols. Experience with enterprise administrative scripting using a major scripting language and experience with software deployment. Travel may be required in accordance with business needs. Related technical experience may be substituted for degree requirements, including Infrastructure support and server administration; supporting and troubleshooting distributed applications, software, and operating systems. Advanced knowledge of network architecture and protocols. Strong experience with enterprise administrative scripting using a major scripting language. 8+ years or more of related technical experience may be substituted for degree requirements, including Infrastructure support and server administration; supporting and troubleshooting distributed applications, software, and operating systems.

You will have ownership over important project areas that include defining the roadmap of data science. You will work with our structured and unstructured data to find a pattern/trend of how our users are using the product and present these insight reports to the business stakeholders. You love sifting through our data troves to find gems for us to work with. You have a sharp mind and hands-on approach when it comes to tackling technical challenges.

Job Responsibilities:
Exploring and visualizing large datasets to drive insights
Fluid at extracting and transforming data from systems using tools
Fluid at practical data mining techniques (pattern detection, predictive modeling, anomaly detection, and optimization) to identify areas of improvement for business/product
Identify and highlight areas of opportunities to help business/product owners optimize existing or new business opportunities/processes
Assist with developing strategies and managing operational metric for various projects
Manage, hiring and mentor your fellow team members
Job Requirements:
Master or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or quantitative discipline
At least 3 to 5 years of hands-on experience in a Data Science role with exposure and proficiency in quantitative and statistical analysis, predictive analytics, multi-variate testing and algorithm-optimization for machine learning
Strong knowledge data exploration algorithms
Fluid in programming skills and database (MySQL, SQL, Python)
Fluid in a variety of visualization packages, preferably in Python
Broad-minded with attention to detail and strong business acumens and insights
Excellent communication skills (oral, written and presentation skills) to work with various stakeholders (technical and non-technical) including presentation of insights reports to business/product owners
Experience working with a product-based organization, e-commerce, automotive is advantageous
Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $5,000.00 to $8,000.00 /month

data science project: 3 years (Required)

Master's (Required)

Since 1974 Linesight has provided professional consultancy services, management support and strategic advice to the global construction industry. From initial concept to project completion, we have been helping clients to build their business. We have developed long-lasting relationships with some of the biggest companies in the world, earning a reputation as a leader in our field.

Due to steady growth in the local market, Linesight is now seeking a Project Engineer for work on a large, complex, new build project in Singapore.
We are seeking an individual with mechanical trades packages experience for the position of Project Engineer. The candidate will work directly with the Construction Manager and the subcontractors throughout the six-year design and construction phase of the largest multistory data center in Asia.
Reporting to the Construction Manager, the candidate will be accountable for ensuring the work required such as submittals, RFI’s, coordination drawings, updating documents, etc are complete, ready and approved for mechanical Subcontractors to perform their scope of work in the strictest of compliance to the contract documents.
It is expected the candidate will be a very detail-oriented individual with previous experience working as a Mechanical Project Engineer on data center projects and or other complex technical projects. There will be a significant amount of “hands on” work coordinating approved design documents and insuring installed work in the field are in compliance with such documents.
Responsibilities:
Develop a comprehensive understanding of the contract documents (drawings and specifications), phasing plans, structural systems interrelationships, construction sequencing and project schedule
Facilitate problem solving, as may arise, between structural, architectural, mechanical, electrical and CSA subcontractors during construction
Work closely with the Construction Manager to lead the mechanical subcontractor installation drawing approval process between the Subcontractor, Resident Engineer, Resident Technical Officer, and the Local Authority having Jurisdiction, and Assist in the receipt and review of all mechanical submissions
Log and post all structural changes and as-built information on field drawings. Provide such information to VDC team so such information can be incorporated into the final virtual model.
Ensure all information is current and communicated with mechanical /project team.
Liaise with the mechanical engineering consultant, supervisory engineers, inspectors and relevant staff
Ensure that mechanical Subcontractors adheres to relevant Quality documentation/records
Assist in the testing and commissioning of mechanical equipment

Are you looking for a career with a leading global organization, working on a dynamic range of projects? Job Description :
You will be part of a team who will be responsible for championing efforts to drive data integration and analytics forward. The solutions may be in the areas of structured or unstructured data. Depending on your area(s) of professional competencies, you will be developing predictive, forecasting or operation research (optimisation) models as part of a larger effort. You may also be involved in text mining and network analytics solutions.

Job Scope(s):
Primarily responsible for applying your skills and knowledge of data analysis, analytics, data science to ensure successful delivery of client engagements and initiatives within our Data & Analytics practice

Assist in collecting / gathering requirements from the clients to understand their current state.

Assist in developing proposals for business pursuits or opportunities.

Attend and assist in facilitating project meetings / workshops with client working team members.

Contribute and support projects in his/her respective expertise area

Produce high quality deliverables/document, with-ready-to-use content

Drive a module or task within a project on their own with minimal supervision

Preparation of user requirements and data development work including documentation

Proactively perform research on the business, industry and domain of the client to keep up to date

Assist in developing project deliverables and assets such as templates, processes, reports, and presentation decks for the client based on work assignment

For Senior Data Scientist you are expected to:
Proactively lead/contribute and support projects in his/her respective expertise area

Lead a team of small - d efficiently

Lead the discussion with client for design, development and testing of enhancements spanning multiple areas and of moderate to high complexity.

End-to-end development of analytical models /data mining projects using SPSS, SAS, R, Python (or similar products)

Preferred industry Coverage: Finance/Banking, Healthcare, Transportation, Logistics

Drive projects of small-d on his/her own with supervision

Present his/her area of expertise confidently

Proactively lead/contribute and support projects in his/her respective expertise area

Requirements

Data Scientist / Senior Data Scientist

Data Scientist - minimum 3 years experience Senior Data Scientist - minimum 4 years experience; Bachelors in Statistics, Computer Science, Economics

With experience in applying Analytics in the following: Human Resource (attrition prediction, performance management, workforce optimisation, etc)

Sales & Marketing (Behaviour segmentation and profile, propensity modelling, campaign optimisation, marketing optimisation, etc)

Finance and operations (sales or demand forecast, inventory optimisation, logistic optimisation, equipment predictive maintenance, contact centre analytics, etc)

Risk and non-compliance (procurement non-compliance, fraud, event and behaviour detection and prediction)

Deep and eager interest in emerging technologies and the ability to leverage those technologies into a solution to meet our strategic and operational client needs

Ability to develop SQL queries and working with data models.

Job Description : You will be part of a team who will be responsible for championing efforts to drive data integration and analytics forward. The solutions may be in the areas of structured or unstructured data. Depending on your area(s) of professi

Roles & Responsibilities

About us

PALO IT is an innovation & agile development company. From Design Research to DevOps, we are in the business of end-to-end development of breakthrough digital experiences. As a community of innovators and developers, we also aim at renewing the way organizations operate, promoting sustainable business agility, user-centricity and open collaboration while having fun doing it.

Started in Paris in 2009 and with offices in Singapore, Sydney, Hong Kong and Mexico, we are looking for our next superstar to join our exciting team in Singapore.

At PALO IT, our employees are not widgets. They are in the center of all our projects and successes. We offer an exciting and creative working environment, with endless opportunities to develop your skills, travel and take your career to the next level. Get in touch to find out more!

Your profile & role on the project

YOU:
Thrive on challenge. When was the last time you fail?
Are curious & always learning. What are you up to right now?
Can deal with constant change. When were you last surprised?
Have mastered at least one skill of your trade but you’re not defined by it.
What can you teach us? Can you wear many hats?

YOU AGAIN:
The Data Scientist will design, build and execute machine learning techniques on large, complex, structured / unstructured data sets to find out hidden patterns and predictive signals. You will research and develop innovating solutions to deliver impact to our clients, contributing to bring intelligence in their digital mesh with the support of other Palo IT experts in Data Intelligence, Research, UX Design, Digital Technology and Agile teams.

Identify use cases allowing to take advantage of AI & Machine learning capabilities
Define data science approaches that fit with clients’ business challenges, using state-of- the-art methods to solve problems of large dimensionality in a computationally efficient and statistically effective manner.
Build advanced algorithms, using statistical knowledge and machine learning techniques to identify trends, patterns and predictive signals on large data sets
Communicate algorithms results, limits and potential for improvement in a meaningful way
Evaluate third party datasets and emerging technologies (e.g. deep learning, NLP) that may contribute to better results
Collaborate with clients and other Palo IT practices to build a comprehensive end-to- end approach, allowing to gather the relevant labeled data and features for ML algorithms as well as effectively embed machine learning outcome into data-driven apps
Participate in development of select assets/accelerators that create scale
Contribute to thought leadership through research and publication support

STILL YOU:
You hold a Bachelor,Master or PhD degree in Computer Science, Statistics or related discipline, and strong academic performance with analytic and quantitative coursework is required
Good knowledge of supervised/unsupervised machine learning techniques and algorithms
Good applied skills with statistical programming languages such as R, Python (NumPy, pandas), SAS, SPSS etc.
Experience with machine learning frameworks (e.g scikit-learn ,SparkMLlib, Caffe, TensorFlow) and/or data science platforms (e.g. SAS, Dataiku)
Data-oriented background in SQL, data wrangling and data modelling
Exposure to data viz tools and/or charting libraries (eg.Tableau, Qlik, D3.js, GGplot)
Willingness to apply advanced data science techniques such as deep learning, reinforcement learning, NLP...
Willingness to be part of a multi-disciplinary team to solve real business problems from end-to-end

Your role at PALO IT

You will be invited to take part in R&D works done within our Data practice. You will have the chance to assist or be a speaker at must-attend international IT conferences. You will have the opportunity to write articles for our Blog or specialized press. Genuine ambassador of PALO IT, you will present our offers and take an active role in the development of the company.

Your technical environment

# Background in math & statistics
# Statistical programming languages: R, Python (scikit-learn library), SAS, SPSS # Data science platforms: SAS, Dataiku...
# Data viz tools: Tableau, Qlik

If you like what you just read, we’d love to have a chat with you!

Our client is looking for a PhD / Masters candidate to work with us to analyse the motion data, determine trends in the data and ultimately, create algorithms to detect key events in the machine based on the live stream of sensor data.

Your responsibilities

Analyse the data to determine patterns for key events such as machine upward and downward acceleration, door open and close cycles, machine being stationary, machine travelling at constant speed and others.

Create algorithms to detect and display such events in real time.

Create algorithms to detect anomalies (which could mean machine failures) and determine what are the cause of those anomalies.

You will work closely with the team who are developing the platform, which provides workflow solutions and information access to stakeholders.

You will have

Ph.D. and Masters students majoring in Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Machine Learning, Operations Research, or other quantitative disciplines.

Experience

Experience in modeling and algorithm development.

Coding proficiency and the ability to develop statistical analysis and prototype algorithms in Python or R.

Proficiency in SQL.

Ability to communicate effectively with both technical and business stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
Applying data mining techniques, doing statistical analysis, and building high quality prediction systems integrated with the Company’s products.
Work closely with both internal & external customers to define problems, acquire required data, enhancing data collection procedures to include information that is relevant for building analytic systems and/or solutions.
Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis & integrating available data with third party sources of information when needed and available

Technical university of Munich - Campus for Research Excellence and Technological Enterprise (TUMCREATE) is a research platform for the improvement of Singapore's public transportation, including the deployment of electric and autonomous mobility. Researchers from Technical University Munich and Nanyang Technological University join forces and are funded by Singapore’s National Research Foundation as part of the Campus for Research Excellence And Technological Enterprise (CREATE).

At TUMCREATE, over 100 scientists, researchers and engineers work together, led by Professors from the Technical University of Munich and Nanyang Technological University. The Mission of TUMCREATE is to seek the ultimate public transport system for the people of Singapore. Our innovative road transport solutions will provide high comfort and a positive travel experience, best protection of the environment and maximum benefit to the society and the economy.

More Information about TUMCREATE can be found by viewing our web pages at http://www.tum-create.edu.sg/

Background

The design of real-world robotic systems is a multi-disciplinary effort. It involves the development of mechanical elements like sensors and actuators, electronic components for connecting and controlling the mechanical elements and software for higher-level planning and process control.

This job profile focuses on development of such robotics systems from the software perspective. The job will be within an emerging deep-tech startup working towards commercialization of SPEEDCARGO - world's first AI-powered robotic solution for automatic build-up and break down of aviation cargo pallets.

More details on the project: https://www.speedcargo.sg/

Objective & Tasks

Development of robot motion planning software
Contribute to software architecture design and implementation of the entire turnkey systems
Development of state machines that define application logic and connect different high level and low-level parts of the system
Integration of several robotics and AI software modules using a middleware such as ROS.Testing and validation at the application and system level

Mandatory Requirements

Since the project will focus on real world deployment of industrial robotics system we require the candidate to have minimum 2-5 years’ experience working on real world industrial robotics projects (preferable in Industry). Candidates with only lab/research experience won’t be considered.
PhD/Master/Bachelor Degree in Computer Science from a reputed university

What we expect from you

Possess skills/ familiar with tools – C/C++, Python, Linux, git, Qt
Knowledge of concepts in Computer Science and Mathematics applied to robotics
Knowledge of motion planning concepts applied to industrial robots
Proven experience with middleware such as ROS.
Experience in hands-on robotics projects in one or more of the following areas: motion planning or control, state machines, physics engines
Experience working with industrial robots is a plus.

What we offer you

An international and multidisciplinary working environment
Opportunity to work on deep-tech robotic system
Challenging tasks with real-life relevance

Enquiries

Dr Suraj Nair (suraj.nair@tum-create.edu.sg)

How To Apply

Please send through a complete application including cover letter, CV, University degrees and transcripts to Dr Suraj Nair at suraj.nair@tum-create.edu.sg

Thank you for your applications, only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

Our client is a global market research and analytics agency with offices across Asia, Europe and the USA. With a small team in Singapore, they work with many blue chip clients including Unilever, Coca Cola and J&J, among others. Their services span advanced analysis, marketing information systems and quantitative research.

This is an exciting opportunity to join the Singapore team where you will work 'on site' at one of their key clients, a global MNC. In this role you spend most of your time at the client's office working as part of their business intelligence team. Responsibilities include understanding client requirements, architecture design, development of reports and dashboards using Tableau.

You will build visualizations that have a ‘wow’ effect as well as ease of use and navigation. You'll get to work with a variety of stakeholders and implement reporting, along with other adhoc data requests.

Aside from working on site with one key client, in time you'll also get the opportunity to work on a broad range of analytics engagements with various clients.

Requirements:
Experience in a business intelligence / analytics / quantitative research role
Experience in management reporting and report automation. Must demonstrate portfolio of capabilities in tableau. Familiarity with graphic design, data visualization and user experience.
Functional and technical knowledge and experience in data warehousing and other leading-edge products & technology in conjunction with industry
Savvy dealing with large data sets and numbers
Meticulous and ready to be hands on in data reconciliation
Good communication skills and capacity to do multi-tasking
Must be a team player with strong interpersonal skills. Must be able to effectively communicate & work with fellow team members and other functional team members to coordinate & meet deliverables
Ability to connect the dots and translate business requirements into data/technology requirements
Fluency in Mandarin language (essential)
Knowledge in databases, technology and programming (SQL, python etc) is preferred

This is an exciting opportunity for someone with the right technical skills, who wants to gain further exposure to working as part of a company’s in-house business intelligence team, as well as gaining broader exposure to a range of research approaches. You must be willing and able to work as part of a small team.

Keywords:
tableau, tableau development, tableau dashboards, analytic consulting, data analytics, dashboards, qualitative research; quantitative research; market research; consumer insights; strategic planning; business intelligence; data visualization; data visualisation

Roles & Responsibilities

Disney+ Hotstar is leading the way as the largest and smartest video platform in the country, reaching over 300 million users today. We have set a number of world records along the way - including for the highest concurrent viewership at 25.3 million during the ICC Cricket World Cup 2019. Disney+ Hotstar today is the one-stop destination for all your entertainment needs - from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ Originals. We’re looking for the brightest minds to build the future of TV with us.

About the Team

We are striving to create the best video content destination for our consumers on a varied set of devices, from phones to tablets, including devices coming out with the bleeding edge of technology.

We are looking for talented individuals to join our growing Data Sciences team, which is developing a fundamentally new approach to how the business generates value from data. This team will develop new methodologies and tools to enable advanced modelling and statistical analysis against petabyte-scale data sets

Our Data Scientists create new sources of data-driven innovation and value for our business. They help our stakeholders respond to their top-priority goals by introducing new ways to tap their exploding data assets, using statistical methods, machine learning, and predictive models

The pace of our growth is incredible – if you want to tackle hard and interesting problems at scale, and create an impact within an entrepreneurial environment, join us!

Your Key Responsibilities

Use techniques from statistical analysis supervised and unsupervised machine learning to deliver relevant business insights and to automate/optimize key processes.
Establish scalable, efficient and automated processes for large scale data analyses, statistical tests, model development and model implementation.
Work with the academic and business community to develop new techniques and to contribute to research in the area of advanced analytics in OTT
Work directly with internal customers to educate them on “moving beyond BI” and training their internal resources to execute advanced forms of analytics.
Own and manage projects end-to-end - requirements definition, project scoping, engagement management, timeline management, documentation and delivery of results.

What to Bring

Degree in computer science with a machine learning focus (other technical degrees also accepted e.g. applied mathematics, statistics, physics)
4+ years of relevant experience in predictive modelling and analysis.
Experience working hands-on with large-scale data sets
Demonstrated experience using Python, R or other statistical/ML software.
Advanced knowledge of statistical and machine learning methods, particularly in the areas of modelling and business analytics
Strong programming skills
Experience with statistical languages and packages, such as R, SAS, Mat-Lab, and/or Mahout
Experience working with relational databases and/or distributed computing platforms, and their query interfaces, such as SQL, MapReduce and Hive.
Experience with additional programming languages, such as Java,Golang and C/C++
Excellent written and verbal communications skills, with a proven ability to translate complex methodologies and analytical results to higher-level business insights and key takeaway
A proven passion for generating insights from data, with a strong familiarity with the higher-level trends in data growth, open-source platforms, and public data sets.
Familiarity with visualization software and techniques (including Tableau), and business intelligence (BI) software, such as Micro-strategy, Cognos, Pentaho, etc
High adaptability in a dynamic start-up environment.

Our Values

Audacity
Self-Awareness
Ownership
Bias for Action
Collaboration
Radical Candour
Inclusivity
Mentorship

Who we are as an employer

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.

Who we are as a company

We’re Disney+ Hotstar. The go-to destination for over 300 million users for everything from Live Sports, Indian and International Shows and Movies to all Disney content, including Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, National Geographic and Disney+ originals. Our mission is to revolutionize internet entertainment through smart personalization, and by building a global video platform that takes over the world wide web and the whole wide world.

About SWAT

SWAT is building next generation urban mobility solutions for the future smart cities of the world. Working with the government and public transport operators, we are reimagining how people move in the future.

We started by building a simulation engine and used real commute data from the government to analyze how factors like operating efficiency and service levels are affected by different input parameters. Next, we replaced simulated vehicles and passengers with mobile apps that translated simulation results into thousands of actual rides and paying customers. Along the way we have learnt a lot from our users and accumulated invaluable knowledge in this space.

If you like solving problems in the mobility space and are looking to join a great team with a great vision, we would like to chat with you!


More about SWAT

We are backed by some awesome venture capital funds and angels
Check out our cool product video
Read about us in the press
Quote from Second Minister Ng Chee Meng:

"We also have SWAT, a local start-up that aims to provide on-demand bus services. The company uses a routing algorithm to pick up and drop off passengers on demand, while dynamically optimising the route in real-time so that the bus has the most efficient route in managing fares and passengers. This could potentially transform how bus services are operated in the future, including public bus services in areas where there is lower ridership, and maybe during low-demand hours."

ABOUT US
Welcome to SITA... We lead one of the most exciting and advanced industries on earth. Around the world, nearly every passenger flight relies on SITA technology, almost every airport and airline does business with us, and it’s our job to support their operations. Our Vision: Easy air travel every step of the way

WHY SHOULD YOU BE INTERESTED?
With us there are no limits for people looking to explore the edges of possibility and beyond. Together, we Go.Far.

Opportunity: Taking on these challenges opens up a world of opportunities for our people. We make sure they have the chance to develop their skills, explore new horizons and grow their careers on a global scale.
At SITA we believe that creating and nurturing an inclusive culture is about who we are as an organisation, and as an employer. Diversity is more than a target to us, it’s a key part out of our collective identity and values.

THE ROLE
The Solution Engineer provides customers with professional, timely, accurate and effective proposals to provide SITA services. The Solution Engineer drives new business opportunities by leveraging knowledge of information technologies and of the air transport industry. The role produces cost effective, deliverable solutions to customers, based on a detailed pre-sales review of customer business requirements, strong product knowledge and applicable professional and technical services. The commercial goals are to increase the overall customer satisfaction, to expand new business revenue, and to promote continuing revenue retention. The role also needs to support Delivery in the capacity of a Solution Engineer which will require documenting the overall solution, including non-functional solution components such as Interface design, Data Migration, Infrastructure design (with the aid of an Infrastructure specialist), etc. This role will work within SITA's Air Travel Solutions line for its Border Management products.

Your role will involve:
Being the prime interface to customers on technical & commercial matters and lead customer engagements, from initial contact to solution deployment;
Establishing and maintaining a professional relationship with customers;
Working with customers to better understand their business and develop sound solutions to meet the customer's business requirements;
Working closely with Account Managers/Directors to develop sales and accounts development strategies;
Promoting SITA by furnishing customers with comprehensive, up-to-date information on current products, product enhancements and new solutions, through customer meetings and workshops;
Designing and co-ordinating the development of business solutions which may involve multiple parties both internally and externally;
Supporting the technical qualification of customers' communication needs through knowledge of current, new or evolving technologies, and SITA solution portfolios;
Liaising with various internal stakeholders, such as Pricing, Software Development, Customer Support, and Project Management, to build business case for customer proposals;
Owning the technical and commercial parts of proposals submitted to customers;
Working closely with project manager to ensure efficient handover of projects for implementation;
Interacting with colleagues to gain and share ideas and opportunities, provide coaching and mentoring in pre-sales activities;
Supporting sales groups or competency centers during the pre-contract phases (qualification proposal and contract) with technical designs and advice;

We would like if you have the below mentioned education, experience, knowledge and skills:
University degree at a Graduate level in a technology discipline or equivalent experience.
7-10 years of experience in Information Technology preferred in a Solution Designer / Solution Engineer / Technical Pre-sales role.
Proven track record in producing, communicating, and documenting successful technical customer solutions.
Design end-to-end enterprise solutions
Sound knowledge in system architecture, business architecture, application architecture, as well as data architecture
Familiarity with system operations management
Capable of interacting with key decision makers
Customer facing and interpersonal skills
Presentation skills

Relational Database, such as Oracle, Microsoft SQL

Are you searching for a dynamic and technically challenging role as a Quality and Reliability Engineer? Do you like exploring new techniques in Non-Volatile Memory (NVM) product qualification and monitoring in high-volume manufacturing?

We are looking for team member who are ambitious and do not hesitate to stretch themselves in order to deliver best-in-class memory products to our customers.

As a NVM QRA Engineer in Global Quality, we are expected to lead product qualification programs, conduct electrical failure analysis and data analysis toward qualification of next-generation 3D NAND memory devices. In order to sustain and improve Micron's memory quality, you will also be responsible for developing and overseeing outgoing monitor plans.

Deviation management is integral in an HVM environment and therefore, you will be tasked to perform risk assessment and provide product disposition.

Responsibilities and Tasks
Define qualification plans, manage qualification requirements, comprehend failures and rates within the scope of qualification, and perform risk assessments on all critical read points within the qualification plan.
Coordinate with other groups such as Process Development, Product Engineering, Design, Manufacturing and other engineering teams involved in the qualification process to ensure appropriate product quality/reliability evaluation methods are developed and followed.
Provide release documentation upon achieving qualification and set up plans to monitor the quality and reliability of the products in the HVM phase.
Coordinate with Research and Development and Product Engineering teams to comprehend new reliability issues and how to test for and assess their impact to customer risk and reliability.
Assist and consult on post qualification quality and reliability issues and assist in the analysis and disposition of these materials.
Perform product failure analysis on rejects to identify the failure mode and mechanisms that will lead to successful corrective actions and/or preventive actions.
Skills and Experience
You need some course work in electrical/electronic engineering, statistical analysis, and device physics. We value team member with an interest semiconductor fabrication processes. Knowledge of NAND & NOR cell technology is a plus. Individuals should have some basic understanding of memory operation and computer language.
Familiarity with basic semiconductor electrical fundamentals (through coursework or employment) is expected. You should also have good analytical and problem-solving skills and be highly motivated. You need a strong work ethic and the capability to work independently and in teams. Strong communication, computer skills, and presentation skills are advantageous.
Education

Bachelor's or Masters degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics Engineering, or a related discipline.

Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters.

Job Title:

Junior Data Scientist

Job Description:
Role Purpose

iProspect helps our clients achieve transformative change in the digital economy. Gleaning insight from data is fundamental to that change. We are looking for data scientists to help grow our technical specialism.

A balance of business and technical skill, Data scientists guide how we use data to understand and optimise media investments.

Your technical skills make you an aspiring data scientist, versed in data acquisition, manipulation and analyses. Your commercial interest ensures that you’d like to apply those skills to client business challenges and see the results; not be stuck in the background. You have the ability to (re)design a process as well as distill complexity into a simple message.

You will join a distinctly ambitious team. We ask a lot, but in return you’ll build excellent career foundations within an industry at the heart of the digital revolution.

Key Accountabilities

The key elements of the role are;
Influence stakeholders, using your analytical experience and technical specialism
Assist on multiple projects across a portfolio of clients
Build and improve existing analytical solutions
Gain practical experience across a range of technologies, including cloud platforms, Ad/MarTech stacks, customer data platforms, verification technology, visualisation tools and more
Oversee data management and governance
Identify weaknesses in processes and reengineer them
Partner closely with the wider agency; working alongside iProspect and other Dentsu Aegis Network teams to apply data to business decisions
Person Specification

We welcome applications from those with 2 to 3 years’ experience.

Essential qualities
Strong logic & quantitative skills, including analytical abilities and mathematical proficiency
Proficient coding; experience in SQL, R, Python, JavaScript are all relevant
Experience with cloud platforms (Google Cloud Platform, AWS, Azure)
Knowledge of analytical modelling; able to determine why a number is right or wrong.
Self-motivated & articulate in explaining technical concepts to a less specialist audience
Great interpersonal skills; ability to build and maintain strong working relationships internally and externally
Strong Microsoft Office skills, notably;
Especially strong in Excel – data wrangling, pivot tables, macros etc
Strong in PowerPoint – data presentation & story telling
Remain calm when faced with multiple tasks; able to prioritise and deliver on time
Willingness to ‘pick up and run’ with projects when necessary; own deliverables and see them to completion
Comfortable working & learning independently, as well as in a team
Understand how we add value to our clients’ business
Fluency in English (written and oral)
Additional skills
Knowledge of digital/marketing fields e.g. SEO, PPC, programmatic and social
Experience with digital tracking technologies
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud Platform)
Experience with data visualisation tools such as Datorama, Qlikview, Tableau
Experience with machine learning
Experience with querying reporting APIs
Experience in additional coding languages
Additional Asian languages

As a member of the Marketing team, you will manage all our business and consumer data and transform them into actionable insights and recommendations for the company. You will provide visibility to shoppers’ behaviors both online and offline, market trends and sales performances of our products across our local and overseas markets and platforms. The scope of work involves data mining, data analytics and interactions with cross functional teams and stakeholders from E-commerce, Retail, CRM and Customer Support.

This role is highly multi-functional providing insights and analytical support to drive our Omnichannel transformation to create a seamless consumer experience across all distribution channels thereby connecting online and offline channels as well as elevating the in-store digital consumer experience. The right person should be someone who can do more than organize the data but leverage on data to influence budgeting and strategic decisions. This role will report to the Marketing Manager.

Responsibilities

· Perform all analytical and reporting related activities on Omnichannel transformation, digital performance, e-commerce platforms, customer database, website behavior, campaigns, CRM, loyalty, retail operations (store efficiencies, product/inventory assortment analysis).

· Lead part of business case analysis to support investment decision for projects and initiatives: Identify and formalize data sources, hypotheses, analysis concepts and financial modelling.

· Facilitate business review discussions to gain insights on Omnichannel KPIs, new service concepts, usage and success of innovative digital solutions against budget and forecast.

· Develop dashboards to gain real time insights, provide data visualization, to allow quick access to view and monitor operational and metric performances.

· Utilize CRM reporting tools to monitor consumer buying trends, monitor progressions and loyalty performances.

· Work on projects and reporting across channels to further shape the Omnichannel Reporting capabilities and landscape to drive the companies shift towards an Omnichannel experience.

· Provide any and all ad hoc marketing analytical requests to assess performance of key marketing tactics / strategies.

· Present and deliver weekly / monthly / ad-hoc reports to management and key stakeholders.

Requirements

· Preferably with 2-5 years' experience within a Data Analyst role, ideally with experience in E-commerce and/or Retail and/or Omnichannel or within an end consumer focused, fast changing, new technology driven environment.

· Familiar with Adobe, Google analytics or any other web analytics tool.

· Working knowledge of SQL, Macros, and SSRS for report writing and data management with solid experience working with popular analytics and BI software tools.

· Passion for the retail industry and the application of analytics to drive and enhance the omnichannel experience.

· Strong understanding of and sensitivity towards data integrity and cleanliness.

· Ability to transform data effectively into meaningful information to support continued improvements, innovations and growth.

· Proven track record as a resourceful self-starter who is creative and comfortable working cross-functionally.

· Clear communicator who can explain and understand complex problems while dealing with both non-technical and highly-technical teams.

· Ability to structure and solve difficult problems with minimal supervision

· Intellectual curiosity coupled with exceptional attention to detail

Solution Delivery - Software Engineer

Company background

Thunes mission is to unlock opportunities for Emerging Markets. We interconnect mobile wallet operators, corporates, merchants, money transfer operators, payment service providers and banks to unlock opportunities for businesses and individuals alike to participate in the global economy.

Providing unparalleled emerging market coverage and smarter transfer solutions for cross border payments, we enable financial inclusivity for those who need it most.

Our Mission

1.7 billion adults worldwide are still excluded from the global economy lacking access to any financial service. We make financial services global and accessible to everyone with our interoperable network supporting local and relevant payment and transfer methods.

Our Solutions

We act as a trusted, neutral aggregator in a deeply fragmented industry. Without a trusted, neutral and interoperable aggregator, the partners of a payment transaction would waste time and costly resources developing their connections to multiple systems. Multiple connections would also mean that these actors have to charge higher prices, which could prohibit financial inclusion and the spread of digital financial services.

We offer key payment solutions to tackle the speed, cost-efficiency and accessibility challenges for emerging markets:
P2P remittance processing
Corporate mass payouts
Digital payment services
International Trade Invoice Payments
CONTEXT OF THE ROLE

We’re looking for a highly driven, self-motivated, technically hands-on person who is truly excited about having a meaningful impact within the company and for our network partners.

In this role, you will combine a startup mindset with the scale of an industry leader. Working with different types of partners you must remain agile and always adapt your process and mindset to the partner you are dealing with.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Lead and deliver the integration into new partner services from the analysis phase through the integration design until go live and post-delivery monitoring
Solution and develop ad-hoc solutions outside of the box for some special projects
Monitor and measure the quality of service of existing partners that are already integrated to the platform
Expand internal monitoring, reporting and operational tools and processes
Drive partners integrating to our network providing technical expertise and support.
On a daily basis, the role will involve you to:
Design and develop API based integrations
Apply coding and analytical skills in all phases of the SDLC – use efficiently version control systems.
Be customer facing – you will have a close relationship with our partners and business development teams to expand our coverage and services
Work closely with different internal teams to understand and support operational processes and new solutions
Always keep a solution mindset and proactively look for improvements that you can bring to the organization
Work with an agile and expanding team
PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE/QUALIFICATIONS

Part of Thunes culture is to value the person’s mindset, drive, and eagerness to constantly learn new things than the length of working experience, motivation and passion is the key to jump on-board!

Minimum bachelor degree in Information Technology, Engineering Computer Science or equivalent 2+ years of experience working and integrating with APIs over IP (REST, Web Services, …
2+ years of experience working and integrating with APIs over IP (REST, Web Services, …)
2+ years of experience in a B2B company supporting partners on a technical solution or service
Experience with PostgreSQL/MySQL or other database systems

Experience with Perl, Python or Go
Experience in project management is a plus

Description
The product verification team is seeking a DFT engineer to join exciting career on Scan, MBIST, iJTAG test development of latest 7nm MPSoC (Multi Processor System on Chip) products and beyond. The IPs range from ARM based Processor to critical IPs which provide automotive, data centre, machine learning and high-speed communication solutions. You will work closely with designers to make sure DFT structures are correctly inserted, with test engineers to make sure ATE test programs can be generated from the DFT (ATPG, MBIST) tools, with product engineers to make sure scan/mbist production test can run seamlessly and stable, and with yield engineers to debug and root-cause failures/defects. You will also be creating RTL design utilizing FPGA fabric resources to build communication logic for stimulus and response delivery between device and ATE.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Work closely with design team and make sure DFT structures are correctly inserted.
• Responsible for developing, implementing and verifying DFT schemes on hard-IPs in FPGAs.
• Responsible for developing and implementing techniques to test digital logic, using Scan Compression, Stuck-at, Transition and Path-Delay fault models
• Responsible for testing other parts of the design, including memory, mixed-signal, I/Os, custom LBISTs & MBISTs, 1149.1 JTAG and IJTAG
• Responsible to develop Firmware driven cost-effective test strategies/methodologies with built-in diagnosis capability to enable efficient debugging and fault isolation on bench/ATE
• Collaborate closely with the New Product Introduction and Test/Product teams to ensure timely delivery of robust test patterns, and manage debugging of pattern issues on bench/ATE to root cause the problem
• Assist in Diagnosis and Yield enhancement through product lifecycle
• Develop an adaptive and cohesive team to take up any challenging tasks entrusted by management

• 5-10 years of experience as DFT engineer
• Experience in creating and implementing complex chip-level DFT architecture
• Experience in DFT implementation including Scan and Scan Compression at IP and SoC level
• Experience with DFT tools, ATPG (Stuck-At, At-Speed, Path-Delay) and scan compression.

Assistant Facilities Engineer

Integrated Facilities Management

What this job involves:

Do you have superior technical know-how when it comes to maintaining a facility? Let’s talk! We always welcome people who can carry our torch for superior quality service.

In this role, you’ll be our go-to guy when it comes to managing our site’s daily operations and technical issues, providing effective solutions whenever difficulties arise. Are you well-versed in workplace safety? As we’ll rely on you to develop and carry out an elaborate preventative program for managing sites. You’ll also make sure that all essential site activities—including the maintenance of electrical, mechanical, chemical, fire protection systems and equipment—are performed in a safe and efficient manner; complying with policies and requirements set out by the government, our client and our own management teams. Your expertise in critical environment procedures may also help you land this job.

Performance Excellence

Are you driven by performance metrics? We find that the best working relationships are fostered by meeting (and exceeding) our service level agreements. This will also be part of your DNA! Working as part of a larger team, you will be involved in ensuring all key performance indicators are met, as set out in the management contract.

Championing Improvement

Do you get excited by improvement works? As part of a larger team, you will be involved in launching various improvement and savings programmes that will benefit both us and our clients. For example, you will be involved in the implementation of energy management programmes to help cut utilities costs and eliminate wastages.

This will involve working closely with our vendors, coordinating with them on a variety of projects—from beginning to end. You’ll see to it that our vendors are managed accordingly, and that technical and safety audits and repairs are in sync with the projects’ timeline.

Putting best practices in place

Do you like sharing ideas to improve the work process? As our facilities engineer, you’ll contribute to the creation of engineering service delivery standards. You’ll also help in the planning, implementation and review of site-specific processes and protocols.

Teamwork should also be one of your strongest points, as you’ll work with a team to ensure that all performance targets set out in the contract are being met. To do this, you’ll develop tools that help measure the technical team’s performance on a quarterly or annual basis.

Sound like you? To apply, you need to be:

A technical hands on expert

An ideal candidate would have a university degree or professional qualification in engineering or facilities management, and over four years’ experience in facilities operation. A strong background in troubleshooting processes is a big plus.

Good communicator

Do you have an excellent command of spoken and written English and Chinese language? Can you communicate technical issues to less able colleagues, clients and vendors? If you said yes to these, bring your ambition and explore our world of possibility.

What we can do for you:

At JLL, we make sure that you become the best version of yourself by helping you realise your full potential in an entrepreneurial and inclusive work environment. We will empower your ambitions through our dedicated Total Rewards Program, competitive pay and benefits package.

Apply today!

Job Description
Develop and implement plans to synthesize, implement including Design-For-Test (DFT) and close timing on complex digital integrated circuits at the block, subsystem or device level (100K to 10M+ gates) which are coded in VHDL/Verilog.
Work with various design groups across different disciplines (Logic, Circuits, DFT & Layout) to meet timing closure, area, power, and performance requirements.
Design, implement and maintain synthesis, DFT and Static Timing Analysis scripts using best-in-class methodologies.
Analyze log and report files to ensure the tools are getting the required results and make adjustments to the scripts to get the required results within the scheduled milestones.
Communicate regularly with the project teams world-wide to resolve issues and to ensure meeting targeted goals and schedule.
Provide/propose new/enhance synthesis, DFT and STA flow and methodology to reduce the development TAT to meet product requirements.


Requirements
Bachelor/Masters Degree in Electrical/Computer Engineering
Minimum 6 years of relevant experience
Good experience and knowledge in design flow from Netlist to GDS, Floor Plan, Synthesis, route , STA, CTS, RC Extraction and correlation
Static timing analysis, power and noise analysis and back-end verification across multiple projects.
Proficient with backend design EDA tools Synopsys (preferred) or Cadence
Experienced in Design-For-Test tools (Tetramax, DFT Advisor) & methodologies (Scan chains, ATPG, BIST, Fault models, Fault Coverage and generation).
Proficient in RTL design using verilog
Successfully track records of taping out complex SOC in 16nm and beyond.
Working knowledge of deep sub-micron routing issues as they relate to power and timing.
Strong scripting skills in Perl, TCL and Shell, particularly in synthesis & timing analysis
Self-motivated team worker, good verbal and written communication skills

Job Title: Automotive Processor and Sensors Test Development Engineer (Engineer/Senior)
Job Description:
Job Id
E1978869
Job Title Automotive Processor and Sensors Test Development Engineer (Engineer/Senior)

Post Date 05/13/2020

Company
Qualcomm Technologies, Inc.

Job Area Engineering - Hardware

Location Singapore - Singapore

Job Overview Company Profile: Qualcomm Technologies, Inc. (QTI) is a world leader in 3G, 4G, 5G and next-generation wireless technologies and a leading developer and innovator of advanced wireless technologies and products. In order to drive our next phase of growth in Automotive, we are expanding the Product Development and Test Engineering group at our Test Center of Excellence (TCE) in Singapore. The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for Automotive application. We work with Design, System, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products.

The Product Development and Test Engineering group develops test solutions for design verification of highly integrated SoC chip for Automotive application. We work with Design, Foundry, Program Management, Yield, Reliability, Marketing, Sales and Manufacturing teams to create, commercialize and support QTIs products. Major Responsibilities: Job responsibilities for the position include designing and debugging of test interface HW (loadboard), test SW (test program) development, HW/SW integration, characterization plan development, first silicon debug, process experiment (split) definition, multiple-source fab matching, device characterization, data analysis, product documentation/presentation, test limit (guardband) generation; driving failure analysis to completion, yield variance control. The job scope also requires the engineer to drive for short term and long term test time reduction and yield improvement to meet set goals without compromising production quality for multiple projects in parallel.

Minimum Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Information Systems, Computer Science, or related field. Preferred at least 3 years experience.
Preferred Qualifications Strong working ATE knowledge (Advantest 93K ATE is preferred) and experience in developing ATE SOC program from NPI stage to volume ramp stage.
Good understanding in semiconductor Functional testing and power measurement.
Basic knowledge on CPU, DSP, GPU will be a plus.
Experience in using collaboration tools such as GIT, SVN and JIRA.
Automotive experience is a plus.
Knowledge of semiconductor manufacturing process. Wafer fabrication fundamentals are a plus.
Knowledge and hands on experience with statistical analysis software package and techniques, quality and reliability testing.
Strong software skills (Java, C/C++, Visual Basic, Perl, Python etc.) for programming and debugging test codes.
Strong verbal and written communications skills. Able to organize effectively and document work thoroughly while working with local and remote teams.
Experience with presenting product and test data driven decisions to management to drive actions.

Roles & Responsibilities

Overview of job

Xaxis is an agency of GroupM, the world’s largest media investment company and are a part of WPP. In fact, we are responsible for one in every three ads you see globally. We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join us.

In this role, you will manage media advertising metadata from different sources. Know how to organize it and build regular reports for client. Provide solutions to client’s business according reliable data analysis. Help driving the science behind predicting and pricing the performance of the recommended media solution developed to deliver on the client’s business goals and marketing objectives. You will be an advisor to all internal teams when estimating & forecasting the value we can guarantee our clients will get in return from their media investment. You will drive the data-driven prediction of the variables and parts within the media solution (format, screen, audience, publisher, media quality) that impact the media solution’s overall contribution to the business goal as committed to the client.

You will conduct extensive and complex analyses to inform strategic decision making, and will define outcome and monetization strategies for our media plans, customized client solutions. You will also optimize product pricing to ensure accuracy and successful execution.

Reporting of the role:
You will report to the Director - Marketing Science APAC.

3 best things about the job:
Holistic exposure and learning of programmatic: an ever-evolving and exciting industry, the role will be working across different departments, teams and clients.
International exposure: Opportunity to work with 15 different markets across Asia Pacific, and the global teams in New York, London and LATAM.
Xaxis focuses on providing leading technology enabled media solutions. You’ll be working on the latest that WPP/GroupM has to offer in digital media technology.

Responsibilities of the role:
Provide the newest advertising data to clients and planning teams regularly across the Asia Pacific region. You will play the role of pricing expert for go-to-market teams and devise pricing strategies for custom solutions / strategic deals. You will be driving the approach to achieving pricing rigour and science in our solutions and products.

The data sources you will be utilizing are:
Fast-moving feeds and slow-moving data, research on customer needs, historical data, Political-Economic-Social-Technological market conditions and internal business intelligence tools.

Your main stakeholders in the company:
Client Strategy, Outcome Media Specialists, Client Engagement and Product teams in the Regional Team based in Singapore

Tasks and Scope of Work:
Analyze Pricing Data
Assess data from a variety of sources and use it to derive insights into pricing strategies and market trends. Use quantitative and qualitative methods to analyze and set pricing of various products and solutions
Develop Forecasts and Models
Use a variety of statistical modeling methods to show the potential impact of various pricing strategies, including their effect on outcomes like Cost-Per-Desired Action.
Determine Pricing and Marketing Strategies
Work closely with relevant stakeholders to develop pricing strategies for media solutions.
Conduct hypothesis-driven analyses to identify and quantify pricing opportunities
Monitor Industry Trends
Maintain knowledge and stay abreast of developments in the industry via information obtained from financial publications and services, government agencies, company sources, and personal interviews. Keep a look out for trends that may have the potential to impact our pricing strategies.
Develop Pricing Tools
Take initiative to develop pricing tools that can be used by our teams to quickly respond to request for proposals. As well as tools that streamline the analysis process and provide more immediate information about inventory and supply prices.
Present Findings to Key Decision-Makers
Present your analysis and findings to stakeholders in relevant forums through weekly or monthly meetings. Translate complex data into actionable strategies and techniques to drive sales and enhance marketing efforts.

What you will need:
Bachelor’s degree in finance, operations, research, statistics, math, economics, or related analytical discipline preferred
Yield management experience with planning, forecasting, and business analysis
Experience within one of these industries - Media, Advertising, AdTech
Work cross-functionally throughout the organization to drive analysis-driven change
Demonstrated complex problem resolution proficiency
Proficiency with analytical and presentation tools {Statistical packages, Excel pivot tables, SQL queries, graphing, PowerPoint}
In-depth knowledge of BI tools (Tableau, Cognos, Business Objects or SPSS)
Practical experience analyzing data, programme metrics and performance

Essential skills:
Analytical thinking – to be able to successfully examine and assess data from a variety of sources
Mathematics – excellent mathematical skills to derive insights from multiple data sources and utilize them to develop models and provide pricing advice to decision-makers
Team collaboration – to work closely with teams and markets
Problem-solving skills – effective problem-solving skills is vital in this role
Communication skills – It is vital to be strong in written and verbal communicators, since you will need to present your findings through reports and presentation

More about Xaxis

Xaxis is The Outcome Media Company. It combines advanced artificial intelligence with proprietary data and proven expertise to optimize programmatic media investments and achieve improved, verifiable results for its clients. Xaxis offers managed programmatic services in 47 markets including North America, Europe, Asia Pacific, Latin America, the Middle East, and Africa. For more information, visit www.xaxis.com

About Singapore

GroupM Singapore operates in one of the most dynamic and exciting environments in the world. Although it is a small domestic market, there is a vibrant media industry which is undergoing rapid evolution as digital technology reshapes the way marketing supports advertisers’ needs. Being at the crossroads of Asia means that aside from the local clients and media owners, we also have a high proportion of multi-national clients and media owners.

As the largest media investment management company in Singapore with over 41% market share (Recma) and over 650 employees, GroupM Singapore is the premiere organisation to join and develop a career in.

GroupM APAC is committed to fostering a culture of diversity and inclusion. Our people are our strength so we respect and nurture their individual talent and potential.

About Marvell


Marvell is empowering the global data economy. Whether at the network core or edge, our leadership technologies make it possible for the world’s data to be processed, moved, stored and secured faster and more reliably. With leading intellectual property and deep system-level knowledge, Marvell's infrastructure semiconductor solutions are transforming the 5G, cloud computing, enterprise and automotive markets of tomorrow.

At Marvell, you’ll see your ideas put to work, share in the success of our company, and achieve a healthy life-work balance in a strong culture of corporate citizenship and global semiconductor leadership. If you are ready to excel, innovate, and truly enjoy where you work, apply now for the position detailed below.

The Opportunity


Key Responsibilities:
Manage product, test engineering activities at our manufacturing sites
Test package release for Wafersort, Finaltest and SLT
New product qualification and transfer
Lot-on-Hold verification/disposition
Yield deviation analysis
Burn-in studies and verification
Customer returns verification
Interface to customers, test development/design teams and strategic partners
Identify and drive test cost reduction and yield improvement projects
Aligns PE systems/process for different manufacturing sites

Minimum 10+ years in semiconductor product engineering experience

Microprocessor and Networking Processor experience is a strong plus
Knowledge of Advantage 93K & Teradyne UFlex test system/software will be an added advantage
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Your Future

If you are driven, personable, and energetic, there will be additional opportunities for you here at Marvell.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status.

The Government Infrastructure Group (GIG) is responsible for providing the ICT Infrastructure where the whole government will rely on for its digitalization effort and smart nation initiatives. The infrastructure layer covers the data centers, networks, cloud and endpoints. The modernization of the infrastructure and related services are underway and further efforts will be required to drive the adoption of advanced technologies to bring greater value to the country.

If you are someone with strong cloud background and passionate about technology, looking for opportunities to work with a team of practitioners and leading industry experts, we welcome you to join GIG.

As a Cloud Infrastructure Architect/Engineer, you will be tasked to lead, architect and develop cloud and infrastructure solutions that has integration to various on premise or SaaS solutions. Knowing a wide range of technologies in term of vertical and horizontal breadths, you will optimize, enhance and support applications in the design and deploy of scalable and highly available solutions. You will also be responsible for the overall technical design, pertaining to the infrastructure elements, integration, connectivity and hosting. Your work will help to enable the Government to leverage on the commercial cloud for the development and deployment of digital services.

What to Expect:
Serve as the deep Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the development of cloud infrastructure solutions which includes multi/hybrid cloud design and implementation
Constantly explore new solutions and technologies, integrate learning and recommendations into the development process
Demonstrate good expertise in all major Cloud Service Providers’ products and solutions
Specialize in the best practice design, operations, and support of private/public/hybrid cloud infrastructure including Network, Storage, Compute and Security
Ensure proposed design gels and aligns to Application, Enterprise, Security architecture as well as the whole-of-Government policies and framework
Create architecture artefacts and documentation to effectively explain architecture design concepts and solutions to various level of stakeholders
Recommend new services to complement and enhance infrastructure elements to stream-line and support applications development and deployment
Apply knowledge of Agile software development and DevOps to infrastructure as code development and deployment
Lead continuous enhancement and exploratory work to design, develop, test and deploy new Cloud Infrastructure technologies using agile methods
Identify potential and emerging technologies relevant to innovation for the Government
Project management of cloud infrastructure setup and implementation
How to Succeed:
Bachelor in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineer, Information Technology or related discipline
Has minimally 8 years’ experience in designing/implementation/consulting of large-scale private/public/hybrid cloud infrastructure solutions
The candidate should have attained professional certifications in the following areas with at least 5 years of implementation experience in:
AWS/Azure/Google Cloud/VMware
Possess hands-on experience and good technical skills with proven track records in IT infrastructure and/or emerging IT technologies engineering in the following area:
Platform, storage, database and virtualization
Cloud infrastructure (IaaS/PaaS)
Container technologies like Dockers, Kubernetes and AWS ECS
Knowledge of with DevOps techniques and Agile practices is an added advantage
Proficient in multi-tiered architecture, design and implementation
Experience with Web and server technologies including Virtualization, Web services, EAI, with knowledge of J2EE and SOA concept
Knowledge of client/server and distributed computing knowledge with messaging, SOAP, .NET and AD
Strong working knowledge and ability to apply architecture concepts, frameworks and methodologies to projects
Experienced in business and technical analysis, architecture design, project management.
Ability to communicate IT architecture methods, concepts, standards and policies
PMP, ITIL and TOGAF certification is an added advantage
Good written and verbal communication and presentation skills, able to interact professionally with all levels of the organization

The individual Systems Engineer primary responsibility is to provide pre-sales technical support on Fortinet security solutions and services.
Candidates should have a strong background in the security domain – network, applications, content, advanced threats and cloud security.
Will provide guidance and assist major accounts sales team within Fortinet sales organization in building solutions to address specific customer security needs.

Responsibilities :

· Provide pre-sales technical guidance and sales support for the development, adoption and implementation of Fortinet security solutions in major accounts opportunities in the sector of Financial Services Industry including Insurance and Private Investment.

· Assists the major accounts sales team in assessing potential application of Fortinet products and solutions to meet customer needs and prepare detailed products/solutions specifications for the development and implementation of customers’ solutions

· Understand the business requirements for major accounts customers’ base and be able to translate them into technical requirement, for the creation of solution design and proposals with Fortinet solutions and services offerings.

· Recognizes, builds and develops business cases for high-impact opportunities.

· Serve as the technical subject matter expert in Fortinet security solutions – thorough understanding of Fortinet products/solutions, features functions and benefits while being able to communicate to all Financial Services Industry customers

· Serve as a trusted advisor to the major accounts customers and channel partners to demonstrate the business value of Fortinet security solutions

· Perform in-depth and high-level technical presentations, solution showcases and proof of concepts (POCs) for major accounts customers and prospects

· Work with major accounts customers and channel partners to define and build Fortinet technical showcases.

· Work with Fortinet technology experts to help position the solution effectively against competing offerings

· Initiate proposals and participate in the writing of RFP/RFQ/RFI/Tender documents templates and responses.

· Maintain up to date on Fortinet product knowledge

· Delivery of Fortinet products, solutions, technology and services offerings update sessions for customers

· Acquire in-depth security knowledge and good understanding to of Cyber Security trends, challenges and technology; to educate customers and prospects

· Keep up-to-date on relevant competitive knowledge including solutions, technology, products and services offering

· Delivery of training classes to customers in the form of technical workshop

Requirements :

· University degree in a technical discipline or equivalent

· At least 8 to 10 years field experience in application, content, cloud and networking security, preferably in an IT vendor environment

· At least 5 to 7 years of field experience working with major or named customers’ accounts as a Systems Engineer or equivalent

· Certifications such as CCNP, CCIE, CEH, CISSP, CISA, CISM, FCNSP (NSE4-NSE7) is preferred

· Strong background and field experience in security domain – Network security (NGFW, IDS/IPS, VPN, IPSec, NAC, etc), Content security (email, web, anti-virus, anti-spam, advanced threats, etc) and Cloud security (Private & Public cloud and CASB)

· Strong working knowledge of Routing & Switching, WLAN, Cloud security, Secure Access and Endpoint security solutions

· Good working knowledge of Windows, Linux, VMware, Openstack, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure and Google Cloud Platform, etc

· Strong working knowledge with Software Defined Networking and Data Center technologies and design

· Experience in supporting large enterprises accounts in Financial Services Industry

· Strong experience in security solution design and proposals

· Excellent written and verbal communication, listening, negotiation and presentation skills

· Relevant expertise and competitive knowledge including competitive solution, technology and product offerings

· Highly motivated self-starter that does not need day-to-day management

· Strong team player, willing to share knowledge and experience with rest of the system engineers.

AI Singapore (AISG) is a national AI programme launched by the National Research Foundation (NRF) to anchor deep national capabilities in Artificial Intelligence (AI).

The programme office is hosted by the National University of Singapore (NUS) and brings together all Singapore-based research institutions and the vibrant ecosystem of AI start-ups and companies developing AI products to perform use-inspired research, grow the knowledge, create the tools, and develop the talent to power Singapore's AI efforts. Our stakeholders and partners include Singapore and international government agencies, universities and research institutions, companies, and venture investors.

As a Platforms Engineer (Data) under the AI & Data Platforms Team, you will collaborate with data scientists and apprentices to build and operate data pipelines and infrastructure to run machine learning and deep learning workloads at scale.

You are a person who strives to improve their knowledge of data engineering, data infrastructure and automation continually.

Recent graduates are welcome to apply for a Junior position for this role provided that they show some experience contributing in a data engineering-related Open Source project for at least a year or similar. Experienced professionals with technical leadership experience in data engineering are welcome to apply for a Senior position for this role.

Join us and be part of a dynamic, fast-paced development team consisting of full-stack developers, AI engineers and data engineers to build AI and Data Products with the AI Singapore collaborators.

The selected candidate will work closely with team members and AI Singapore collaborators to build AI and Data products.
Decompose complex problems, troubleshoot issues and communicate solutions to the team and other stakeholders.
Design, implement, maintain, and administer data infrastructure, pipelines, systems and other tools to support AI Singapore projects and collaborators.
To train and mentor apprentices and new engineers on data engineering, including creating necessary materials to deliver the training.
Understand the current state of data engineering, data infrastructure and automation technologies and the ability to apply to business challenges.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or relevant experience.
Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving skills.
Intermediate proficiency in Python programming.
Two or more years of engineering experience with data pipelines and infrastructure on Cloud or on-premise.
Two or more years of SQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL) experience including complex queries and optimization.

To succeed in this role, we are looking for you to have a majority of the following knowledge and skills:

Experience in administering SQL and NoSQL databases: MySQL, PostgreSQL, Cassandra.
Experience with using data structures, data models, data encoding formats and data processing techniques to support large scale data analysis.
Experience in using and developing data-related APIs.
Experience in Linux administration. Ability to communicate complex concepts to collaborators with a range of technical expertise.
Experience with container technologies such as Docker, Singularity and Kubernetes.
Experience with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure or AWS and their data-related services.
Experience with Python data science libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, scikit-learn.
Experience with data processing frameworks and technologies such as Apache Arrow, Dask, Kafka, Spark, or ElasticSearch.
Experience with data mining, machine learning, deep learning technologies.
Active in contributing to data-related Open Source projects will be advantageous.
