Provide Strategic Support in Quality Program/Project Management
Develop, manage, and/or communicate quality strategy with line of sight metrics and goals to monitor execution health.
Lead cross-functional initiatives or enabling projects that support FLT and companywide quality objectives.
Develop and drive compliance in global business process related to product quality.
Manage the projects to enable the implementation path for new initiatives.
Provide Tactical Support
Work with cross-functional team to develop and deploy BKMs of BE to FE collaboration process like WL DPM forecast and RMA DPM reduction etc.
Develop metric to monitor product targets, including PGL, Critical RD and DPM etc. Work with fab teams to meet targets and provide the roadmap.
Part of the FE quality team contributing as SME in reliability fail modes and its associated detection, drives and engages in quality projects for overall DPM reduction.
Work with fab team to act on and provide Corrective and Preventive Actions with regards to customer feedbacks on quality and product issues.
Work with fab team and collaborate with MCT PIE to ensure fast internal DPM reduction during tech node ramping.
Work with fab and PIE on process changes to improve DPM and repair density performance
Qualifications:
DRAM architecture, operation, and specification knowledge
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Excellent communication and presentation skills
Experience analyzing probe, backend test data, module test data a plus
Knowledge of process improvements impacting electrical fail mode
Strong project management skills a plus
GJS E3 and above
Ability to travel. Work location in Boise, Singapore or Taiwan.
Behaviors:
Strong collaboration skills
The ability to multitask responsibilities while staying aware of key priority items
Self-motivation and enthusiasm
Education
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
Experience
3 years’ experience in Engineering or engineering experience in a PI, PYE, PE, design, or QRA.

Possess a solid understanding of web applications, database, security, and auditing environments

Job Title: Capacity Planning Engineer ( Fresh graduates are welcome to apply) 1
Job Description:
Req. ID: 146045

Job Description

As a Back End Central Planning Capacity Planning Engineer at Micron Technology, you will engage with Back End Planning and Industrial Engineering teams, Engineering, Factory Network and Supply Chain to optimize Network requirements and drive improvement in business processes. You will be interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to identify resources required to support the plan and follow up on actions to close identified gaps. You will monitor build plans, analyze CTM solves and CSM bucket report to ensure that manufacturing sites have the needed capacity to perform as planned.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Capacity Methods and Integration
Understanding the implications of modeling assumptions in CSM and CTM solves
Audit model assumptions versus actual factory performance and drive gaps closure (Utilization, EPT, load size, lot size, using static and dynamic models)
Influence decision making process to optimize the network capacity to improve supply availability
Able to efficiently perform what-if analysis and provide data driven recommendations
Develop capacity business processes and specify requirements
Drive Benchmarking Process
Work with site IE, MFG and Engineering to understand and close the gaps in workstation performance to meet external benchmark levels
Drive areas to close gaps in performance of tools with in a workstation through internal benchmarking
Headcount model benchmarking
Manage Capital Process
Optimize capital resources by initiating asset transfers in the global network
Collaborate with the sites to minimize capital spending via productivity improvements and optimizing available equipment and tooling
Coordinate capital purchase to meet flex capacity percentages
Monitor adherence to capital cycle and on time funding submissions
Audit tool count to align with MICAP and SIG delivery dates
Participate in Capacity Related Projects
Support systems and tools adoption related to Capacity Planning
Support manufacturing efficiency efforts for the site (cycle time, utilization improvement, constraints management, capacity optimization)
Participate and influence design of capacity systems to convert all planning related assumptions and models
Ensure a Safe, Compliant, and Ethical Work Environment
Comply with company safety, labor, and ethics policies
Participation in mandatory safety trainings
Encourage a culture of safety and contribute to a safe work environment
Provide timely feedback when quality, safety, or ethical issues arise
Follow and support company-wide and department safety procedures to maintain a clean, safe, and accident-free work environment
Promote high integrity processes that will enable immediate sharing of problems, issues and solutions with management team
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Engineering
Good in written communication and presentation skills
Highly motivated to work in a dynamic environment, with good integrity and character
Ability to multi-task and organize work systematically in meeting deadlines without compromising on quality
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications, etc.

This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members' disabilities or religious beliefs and practices.

Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters.

Job Title: SVP/ Director, Head of IT Infra Services, Data Center & DevOps
Job Description:
SVP/ Director, Head of IT Infrastructure Services, Data Center & DevOps wanted for a top conglomerate firm!

High profile leadership role
Dynamic and collaborative work culture
Opportunity to work on interesting projects

Our client is a well- known Conglomerate with over 70 years of long standing history and currently has multiple subsidiaries across the business.

As the company is currently undergoing a major digital and infrastructure transformation journey, they are currently looking for a Senior IT leader to lead their overall IT Infrastructure Transformation across the group. Reporting to the Group CIO, you will lead the design and architecture of the IT Infrastructure strategic roadmap for the group. You will be also expected to lead their migration journey from On- prem Data Centres to public cloud environment such as Google Cloud or AWS. You will also lead a team of DevOps Engineers and implement the latest DevOps methodologies and gain buy- in to ensure everyone would follow the best practices.

This is a great opportunity for someone who would like to join a forward thinking company which is looking to change the way they do things digitally to empower both employees and customers.

To qualify, you must have the following:
Holds at least a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineer or other related fields of study
Has at least 15 years of overall IT Infrastructure experience, with at least 7 years of senior leadership experience leading the Infrastructure services & Data Center function
Strong experience in all aspects of Data Centers, including build, migration/ co-location and operations
Deep technical expertise in managing public cloud environment, such as Google Cloud or AWS
Experience with managing DevOps teams and has expertise in DevOps and configuration management tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jira, Git.
Holding certifications such as ITIL, MSCE etc would be a huge plus
Excellent communication skills with the ability to act as a business partner to engage with senior management and get buy- in from them by influencing them

If you have what it takes, please send your resume to daniel.ong@ambition.com.sg or click APPLY NOW. For more information, please visit www.ambition.com.sg.

About AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

Our intention is to evolve AXA REV (Research, Engineering & Vision) Singapore to the next level, in alignment with Group Data & Technology Innovation mission to support in transformation journey of AXA in Asia towards tech led company.

Accelerate innovation cycles (“to go faster from insights to action”) and increase adoption rate of innovation (“to deliver innovation at scale”) in Asia.

Be a forward thinker on data & technology and gain credibility and knowledge by combining our hands-on expertise with Group’s research & thought leadership on emerging technologies and its implications in Asia.

Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.This is your chance to work on the team that helps Facebooks Platform partners, marketers, and advertisers build engaging social applications based on the Facebook Platform. As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be the first point of contact for bug reports and platform development questions raised by the Facebook Platform developer community. You will assist our developers by providing creative solutions to challenging technical issues, while also working with the internal engineering teams to ensure all issues raised are dealt with in a timely manner. In addition to this you will be responsible for building and improving our internal support tooling and reporting. This is a full-time role based in Singapore.

Responsibilities:

Provide world class support to the Facebook Platform developer community
Become an expert in our products, our developers and their needs by providing effective technical consultation
Manage technical and product issues and escalations, delivering the highest level of developer satisfaction
Help scale developer support with Sales and Partnership growth
Work directly with developers to resolve technical issues
Engage with the operations and engineering teams to build, drive and improve our tools and processes
Write production code that will improve our internal tooling and our external support channels Build product insights from developer experience/sentiments and work with cross-functional partners to take appropriate action
Deliver data-driven, impactful results
Lead projects end-to-end from ideation, design, build, and launch
Build understanding about the wide variety of software across the Platform at a deep engineering level

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent degree and experience)
5+ years of experience in software development
Programming abilities in one or more of the following languages: Java, PHP, Objective-C, Python and Ruby
Excellent communication skills in English, particularly written communication
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills
Experience developing for mobile would be an advantage
Preferred Qualifications:

Refinitiv Labs provides a unique opportunity to work in a global company with a culture of a start-up.

As a part of our growing Singapore Lab team of data scientists, engineers and UX/UI designers you will be part of our global network of like-minded colleagues in our sister labs in London and New York.

We are looking for a Fontend Engineer capable of producing scalable software solutions. You will be part of a cross-functional team thats responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to development.

You should have strong experience with front-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries. You should also be familiar with visual design and be willing to work with a team.

Responsibilities

Creating compelling proposals with technologists in partnership with business, driving innovation from conception to production

Critical thinking, value judgment and common sense over process.

Positive attitude to learning new skills and technologies.
Diploma / Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / or equivalent.

Job Description

As an MSB Assembly Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D, SPC, Six Sigma & DMAIC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment
Maintain in-depth process knowledge in DA & WB
Maintain materials and equipment knowledge as it relates to the process and how they interact
Optimize process and/or equipment variables
Identify all process variations and work towards variability control
Apply DOE techniques
Perform containment of process and equipment deviations, process mapping and commonality study
Determine root cause and implement corrective actions & preventive actions
Maintain FMEA, SOP, QCP, OCAP
Evaluate Future Process, Equipment and/or Material Technologies
Evaluate pertinent technology and engineering advancements relating to equipment, materials and processes
Locate and research technical information on equipment, materials, and/or processes in journals, literature, web, etc
Build and maintain effective relationships with suppliers
Identify supplier’s materials or equipment design and production processes
Create decision matrix for equipment and material selection
Develop Process of Record (POR)
Define and document customer requirements
Define process variables
Define process edges and center the process (CPK)
Qualify New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and implement quality systems
Maintain knowledge of Assembly’s qualification procedures
Maintain knowledge of Quality and Reliability Assurance (QRA)
Implement New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and maintain operation procedures
Review current procedures on an on-going basis
Maintain knowledge of Assembly On-Line Document System (AODS) and change communication procedures: ECN (Engineering Change Notice)
Assess material requirements and projections
Maintain knowledge of material attributes (shelf life, storage requirements, etc.)
Ensure materials compatibility with equipment and parameters
Maintain knowledge of supplier’s constraints
Maintain knowledge of new chemical/material approval process and MICIS (Micron Chemical Information Systems)
Coordinate Training Requirements and Conduct Training
Develop, or coordinate development of, training materials for existing/new process
Conduct training for production trainers
Train and mentor others
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Material Science/ Mechatronics Engineering
Minimum 3 years experience in assembly processes
Fast learner, with initiative and independence (min supervision)
Good team player
Familiar with QC tools, Engineering data & statistics analysis application in manufacturing environment (added advantage)

Are you as comfortable debating the computational complexity of an algorithm with your colleagues as you are explaining your job to your grandma?

Then we may have the gig you’re looking for!

About Zyllem

Zyllem is a fast-growing software company based in Singapore. Our software connects the fragmented logistics network by allowing enterprises to build and manage their entire distribution network that includes partnerships and own assets in one platform. We are supported by key VCs and have acquired key strategic customers across SEA including the largest retailer in Singapore, the largest health distributor in SEA, and the largest cold-chain in Singapore.

The Position: Senior Software Engineer

Our best engineers are passionate about coding. If you dream of abstract factories and enjoy debating about composition over inheritance, then you’ll be in good company!

You’re great at:
Backend development in general - 5+ years of experience
Coding in C# and mastering OOP principles and design patterns
Working efficiently with MongoDB
Building RESTful APIs
Communicating well in English
“Nice to haves” a.k.a. what makes you even more wonderful
You can contribute to the Frontend (Javascript / Typescript / LESS)
You developed a Devops mindset in your previous roles
You have a good presence on the Web (stackoverflow, Github, a blog maybe?)
You have already worked in a startup, so you understand how things can be
You know everything there is to know about Agile methodologies
Here’s a bit about us:

Zyllemites are good, smart people with a great sense of humour. We enjoy hanging out with each other on Friday over drinks. We speak many languages and respect all cultures. We take our work seriously, but ourselves not too much. Professionalism and integrity are work ethics we strive for.

So if corporate life leaves you cold, and you can stand the creative chaos of a tech start up in the “world’s most tightly packed entrepreneurial ecosystem” (yup, according to The Economist, Blk 71 is the centre of the start up universe…) then let’s talk!

P.S. Even if this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who’d be a perfect fit. Send them this link. Thanks!

This role is with Right-Hand Cybersecurity, a startup supported by SGInnovate.

At Right-Hand, our mission is to make humans more defensible against cyber threats. In today’s dynamic and ever evolving threat landscape, cyber attackers possess advanced capabilities to evade traditional technological security layers (like an email security platform or a firewall). This forces the company’s employees to serve as the last line of defense. However, with roughly 90% of cyber attacks occurring due to human error, it is evident that most employees are not prepared for these scenarios. Right-Hand is uniquely positioned to help organisations address this massive issue and reduce human influenced cyber risk.

The Job
As a Software Engineer at Right-Hand, you will be part of our small, agile team that is building and designing our next generation cyber security platform. Working across our stack, you will be responsible for creating end-to-end microservices that support business operations as we scale and grow our client base. Our ideal candidate is an experienced Rails and front-end React developer who thrives in an agile environment and has a passion for developing high-quality, maintainable code using the latest technologies. We are looking for curious, collaborative teammates who are eager to teach what they already know and is excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications. Your technical judgment and experience will help us build the tools today that will redefine tomorrow’s cybersecurity landscape.

Technologies we use: Rails, Angular, React, Amazon cloud service, Docker/Elastic, AWS Lambda, RSpec

As a Software Engineer, you will:
Write rock solid, well-tested and maintainable code in Rails 5x, React and technology stack we will be adopting down the road
Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining core web applications and microservices
Ensure that standards and principles are adhered to and communicated to other stakeholders on the team
Identify performance bottlenecks, use good coding patterns to avoid them in the first place, and optimise existing large-scale complex systems
Participate in code reviews
Keep abreast of relevant technologies, systems, tools, processes, and make recommendations and decisions on inclusion into the Right-Hand development methodologies and product architecture
You bring to the table:
2 - 6 years of experience in Ruby on Rails, ReactJS and NodeJS
Hands-on experience in designing and developing end-to-end applications
Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
Self-disciplined and pays attention to quality, details, and most importantly, results
You like to share - you write code that is modular and extensible whenever possible and leave code better than you found it
An eager to learn mindset, positive attitude, and an unrivalled level of effort
It’s great, but not required, if you have:
Experience in the Cybersecurity industry
Experience building microservices
Experience building APIs
Knowledge of containerisation and AWS

Sales Engineer - Singapore

The Opportunity
Due to our growth, our Imperva team is looking for a high energy and customer centric Sales Engineer (SE), to join the Global Field Sales Team, to be preferably based in Singapore

You will be supporting an award winning Enterprise Field Sales Team who consistently hit their commission accelerators and attend President's Club so we are looking for an exceptionally talented, motivated Senior Sales Engineer to bring their 'A game' and join a successful Team.

Imperva is a pioneer and leader of a new category of business security solutions for critical applications and high-value data in the data center. Thousands of the world’s leading businesses, government organizations, and service providers rely on Imperva solutions to protect against data breaches, meet compliance mandates, and manage data risk.

The Sales Engineer (SE) will work alongside the Regional Sales Managers, as part of the Global Sales Team and oversee the sales support of Imperva's SecureSphere Web Application and Database Security/Compliance products to existing and prospective customers with the assigned geographic region. The SE is an integral part of the sales organization and assists the sales team with pre-sales technical knowledge and presentations. They work closely with sales managers, prospects and partners as a subject-matter expert to demonstrate how a proposed solution meets and exceeds customer requirements.

Responsibilities:
Participate in sales conference calls and prospect visits, providing product demonstrations in person and via WebEx, and working with prospects at both a technical and business level to show how Imperva’s solutions can provide value to them.
Possess demonstrable skills in customer-centric selling and a proven track record using it to help drive revenue.
Participate as a technical resource at trade shows and conferences, when needed.
Work independently and as a vital member of a sales team.
Work with the sales team to strategize on sales approaches to develop business.
Ensure successful on-site product evaluations and post sale installations when necessary.
Manage the Regional Strategic Account customer base on their technical needs.
Plan, manage and execute customer product pilots.
Qualifications:
3-5 years of experience in network security, development, pre-sales engineering, or real world use of database and/or web application solutions; preferably with 2+ of these as a sales engineer and experience working in a start-up and vendor environment
Possess a solid understanding of web applications, database, security, and auditing environments
Must have experience with Linux
Must have knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, Load balancers, proxies and firewalls
Compliance standards knowledge (PCI, SOX, HIPAA) – an advantage
Knowledge in databases (Oracle, MS SQL, Sybase, DB2) – a significant advantage
Knowledge in application development (ASP, .NET, PHP, JSP) – an advantage
Experience with scripting and/or using RegEx - an advantage
Knowledge of advanced internet route selection protocols - an advantage
Excellent time management, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills.
Excellent written, oral communication and strong interpersonal, organizational and presentation skills
Able to effectively present technical material to small and large groups
Requires 50% travel availability and flexibility
Our Company
Imperva is an analyst-recognized, cybersecurity leader—championing the fight to secure data and applications wherever they reside. Once deployed, our solutions proactively identify, evaluate, and eliminate current and emerging threats, so you never have to choose between innovating for your customers and protecting what matters most. Imperva—Protect the pulse of your business. Learn more: www.imperva.com, our blog, on Twitter.

Legal Notice

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Oversee, drive and lead teams in critical facilities such as data centres

Source and secure new business opportunities/ projects
Provide leadership, guidance and training and improve the technical knowledge of the supporting staff
Standardize technical standards and performance specification for the Company

Job Title: Capacity Planning Engineer ( Fresh graduates are welcome to apply) 1
Job Description:
Req. ID: 146045

Job Description

As a Back End Central Planning Capacity Planning Engineer at Micron Technology, you will engage with Back End Planning and Industrial Engineering teams, Engineering, Factory Network and Supply Chain to optimize Network requirements and drive improvement in business processes. You will be interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to identify resources required to support the plan and follow up on actions to close identified gaps. You will monitor build plans, analyze CTM solves and CSM bucket report to ensure that manufacturing sites have the needed capacity to perform as planned.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Capacity Methods and Integration
Understanding the implications of modeling assumptions in CSM and CTM solves
Audit model assumptions versus actual factory performance and drive gaps closure (Utilization, EPT, load size, lot size, using static and dynamic models)
Influence decision making process to optimize the network capacity to improve supply availability
Able to efficiently perform what-if analysis and provide data driven recommendations
Develop capacity business processes and specify requirements
Drive Benchmarking Process
Work with site IE, MFG and Engineering to understand and close the gaps in workstation performance to meet external benchmark levels
Drive areas to close gaps in performance of tools with in a workstation through internal benchmarking
Headcount model benchmarking
Manage Capital Process
Optimize capital resources by initiating asset transfers in the global network
Collaborate with the sites to minimize capital spending via productivity improvements and optimizing available equipment and tooling
Coordinate capital purchase to meet flex capacity percentages
Monitor adherence to capital cycle and on time funding submissions
Audit tool count to align with MICAP and SIG delivery dates
Participate in Capacity Related Projects
Support systems and tools adoption related to Capacity Planning
Support manufacturing efficiency efforts for the site (cycle time, utilization improvement, constraints management, capacity optimization)
Participate and influence design of capacity systems to convert all planning related assumptions and models
Ensure a Safe, Compliant, and Ethical Work Environment
Comply with company safety, labor, and ethics policies
Participation in mandatory safety trainings
Encourage a culture of safety and contribute to a safe work environment
Provide timely feedback when quality, safety, or ethical issues arise
Follow and support company-wide and department safety procedures to maintain a clean, safe, and accident-free work environment
Promote high integrity processes that will enable immediate sharing of problems, issues and solutions with management team
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Engineering
Good in written communication and presentation skills
Highly motivated to work in a dynamic environment, with good integrity and character
Ability to multi-task and organize work systematically in meeting deadlines without compromising on quality
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications, etc.

Job Description:
SVP/ Director, Head of IT Infrastructure Services, Data Center & DevOps wanted for a top conglomerate firm!

High profile leadership role
Dynamic and collaborative work culture
Opportunity to work on interesting projects

Our client is a well- known Conglomerate with over 70 years of long standing history and currently has multiple subsidiaries across the business.

As the company is currently undergoing a major digital and infrastructure transformation journey, they are currently looking for a Senior IT leader to lead their overall IT Infrastructure Transformation across the group. Reporting to the Group CIO, you will lead the design and architecture of the IT Infrastructure strategic roadmap for the group. You will be also expected to lead their migration journey from On- prem Data Centres to public cloud environment such as Google Cloud or AWS. You will also lead a team of DevOps Engineers and implement the latest DevOps methodologies and gain buy- in to ensure everyone would follow the best practices.

This is a great opportunity for someone who would like to join a forward thinking company which is looking to change the way they do things digitally to empower both employees and customers.

Holds at least a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineer or other related fields of study
Has at least 15 years of overall IT Infrastructure experience, with at least 7 years of senior leadership experience leading the Infrastructure services & Data Center function
Strong experience in all aspects of Data Centers, including build, migration/ co-location and operations
Deep technical expertise in managing public cloud environment, such as Google Cloud or AWS
Experience with managing DevOps teams and has expertise in DevOps and configuration management tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jira, Git.
Holding certifications such as ITIL, MSCE etc would be a huge plus
Excellent communication skills with the ability to act as a business partner to engage with senior management and get buy- in from them by influencing them

About AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

Our intention is to evolve AXA REV (Research, Engineering & Vision) Singapore to the next level, in alignment with Group Data & Technology Innovation mission to support in transformation journey of AXA in Asia towards tech led company.

OUR PURPOSE

Accelerate innovation cycles (“to go faster from insights to action”) and increase adoption rate of innovation (“to deliver innovation at scale”) in Asia.

Increase entity transformation on data & technology innovation with a stronger collaboration with and in Entities and Group functions (joint ideation, co-creation, seed-funding, advisory, best-practice sharing, community building in data & technology) within Asian Markets and Select International Markets supported by Group Data and Technology Innovation.

Improve innovation scaling through an integrated delivery model with AXA GO Shared Services team in Manila/ KL and strong tech-related external partnerships.

Focus our efforts on the top 10+6 AXA entities, Group functions are well as the transversal business units P&C Commercial (XL/ACS/Art), IM and Group Innovation within Asia.

Be a forward thinker on data & technology and gain credibility and knowledge by combining our hands-on expertise with Group’s research & thought leadership on emerging technologies and its implications in Asia.

What We Offer
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.This is your chance to work on the team that helps Facebooks Platform partners, marketers, and advertisers build engaging social applications based on the Facebook Platform. As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be the first point of contact for bug reports and platform development questions raised by the Facebook Platform developer community. You will assist our developers by providing creative solutions to challenging technical issues, while also working with the internal engineering teams to ensure all issues raised are dealt with in a timely manner. In addition to this you will be responsible for building and improving our internal support tooling and reporting. This is a full-time role based in Singapore.

Responsibilities:

Provide world class support to the Facebook Platform developer community
Become an expert in our products, our developers and their needs by providing effective technical consultation
Manage technical and product issues and escalations, delivering the highest level of developer satisfaction

Job Description

As an MSB Assembly Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D, SPC, Six Sigma & DMAIC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment
Maintain in-depth process knowledge in DA & WB
Maintain materials and equipment knowledge as it relates to the process and how they interact
Optimize process and/or equipment variables
Identify all process variations and work towards variability control
Apply DOE techniques
Perform containment of process and equipment deviations, process mapping and commonality study
Determine root cause and implement corrective actions & preventive actions
Maintain FMEA, SOP, QCP, OCAP
Evaluate Future Process, Equipment and/or Material Technologies
Evaluate pertinent technology and engineering advancements relating to equipment, materials and processes
Locate and research technical information on equipment, materials, and/or processes in journals, literature, web, etc
Build and maintain effective relationships with suppliers
Identify supplier’s materials or equipment design and production processes
Create decision matrix for equipment and material selection
Develop Process of Record (POR)
Define and document customer requirements
Define process variables
Define process edges and center the process (CPK)
Qualify New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and implement quality systems
Maintain knowledge of Assembly’s qualification procedures
Maintain knowledge of Quality and Reliability Assurance (QRA)
Implement New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and maintain operation procedures
Review current procedures on an on-going basis
Maintain knowledge of Assembly On-Line Document System (AODS) and change communication procedures: ECN (Engineering Change Notice)
Assess material requirements and projections
Maintain knowledge of material attributes (shelf life, storage requirements, etc.)
Ensure materials compatibility with equipment and parameters
Maintain knowledge of supplier’s constraints
Maintain knowledge of new chemical/material approval process and MICIS (Micron Chemical Information Systems)
Coordinate Training Requirements and Conduct Training
Develop, or coordinate development of, training materials for existing/new process
Conduct training for production trainers
Train and mentor others
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Material Science/ Mechatronics Engineering
Minimum 3 years experience in assembly processes
Fast learner, with initiative and independence (min supervision)
Good team player
Familiar with QC tools, Engineering data & statistics analysis application in manufacturing environment (added advantage)

This role is with Right-Hand Cybersecurity, a startup supported by SGInnovate.

At Right-Hand, our mission is to make humans more defensible against cyber threats. In today’s dynamic and ever evolving threat landscape, cyber attackers possess advanced capabilities to evade traditional technological security layers (like an email security platform or a firewall). This forces the company’s employees to serve as the last line of defense. However, with roughly 90% of cyber attacks occurring due to human error, it is evident that most employees are not prepared for these scenarios. Right-Hand is uniquely positioned to help organisations address this massive issue and reduce human influenced cyber risk.

The Job
As a Software Engineer at Right-Hand, you will be part of our small, agile team that is building and designing our next generation cyber security platform. Working across our stack, you will be responsible for creating end-to-end microservices that support business operations as we scale and grow our client base. Our ideal candidate is an experienced Rails and front-end React developer who thrives in an agile environment and has a passion for developing high-quality, maintainable code using the latest technologies. We are looking for curious, collaborative teammates who are eager to teach what they already know and is excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications. Your technical judgment and experience will help us build the tools today that will redefine tomorrow’s cybersecurity landscape.

Technologies we use: Rails, Angular, React, Amazon cloud service, Docker/Elastic, AWS Lambda, RSpec

As a Software Engineer, you will:
Write rock solid, well-tested and maintainable code in Rails 5x, React and technology stack we will be adopting down the road
Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining core web applications and microservices
Ensure that standards and principles are adhered to and communicated to other stakeholders on the team
Identify performance bottlenecks, use good coding patterns to avoid them in the first place, and optimise existing large-scale complex systems
Participate in code reviews
Keep abreast of relevant technologies, systems, tools, processes, and make recommendations and decisions on inclusion into the Right-Hand development methodologies and product architecture
You bring to the table:
2 - 6 years of experience in Ruby on Rails, ReactJS and NodeJS
Hands-on experience in designing and developing end-to-end applications
Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
Self-disciplined and pays attention to quality, details, and most importantly, results
You like to share - you write code that is modular and extensible whenever possible and leave code better than you found it
An eager to learn mindset, positive attitude, and an unrivalled level of effort
It’s great, but not required, if you have:
Experience in the Cybersecurity industry
Experience building microservices
Experience building APIs
Knowledge of containerisation and AWS

About AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

Our intention is to evolve AXA REV (Research, Engineering & Vision) Singapore to the next level, in alignment with Group Data & Technology Innovation mission to support in transformation journey of AXA in Asia towards tech led company.

OUR PURPOSE

Accelerate innovation cycles (“to go faster from insights to action”) and increase adoption rate of innovation (“to deliver innovation at scale”) in Asia.

Increase entity transformation on data & technology innovation with a stronger collaboration with and in Entities and Group functions (joint ideation, co-creation, seed-funding, advisory, best-practice sharing, community building in data & technology) within Asian Markets and Select International Markets supported by Group Data and Technology Innovation.

Improve innovation scaling through an integrated delivery model with AXA GO Shared Services team in Manila/ KL and strong tech-related external partnerships.

Focus our efforts on the top 10+6 AXA entities, Group functions are well as the transversal business units P&C Commercial (XL/ACS/Art), IM and Group Innovation within Asia.

Be a forward thinker on data & technology and gain credibility and knowledge by combining our hands-on expertise with Group’s research & thought leadership on emerging technologies and its implications in Asia.

At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Roles & Responsibilities

The Player Intelligence Division is a transversal entity, which operates across the Singapore and Chengdu studios, with the purpose of advocating and implementing best practices in terms of business intelligence, customer insights, big data, and playtest management.

Reporting to the Head of Business Intelligence, the Senior Analyst will act as a consultant within production team and help transform the needs of the various stakeholders (producers, art directors, designers, monetisation directors, etc.) into actionable KPIs.

He /She will be able to navigate around the complexity of the project, to understand to questions, blockers and challenges faced by the teams, and to define and implement analytical processes to answer these needs with actionable recommendations.

The Senior Analyst will be able to interact with technicians and to understand the complexity of software infrastructure.

He /She will put in place systems that will allow the whole team to gather real-time feedback about the players’ behaviour and to transform them into real time game improvement.

He / She will provide reports and insights and interact and learn with regional and global Analytics teams.

Extremely analytical, quantitative and comfortable with data, he/she will be able to recruit and manage data analysts to deliver reports and dashboard to support the project.

Responsibilities
Source needs from the teams and transform them into actionable methodologies and analysis
Work closely with the development team to define business and technical requirements for integrating new tracking into the game
Perform analysis and produce meaningful insights and recommendations to improve game design, player acquisition, retention and monetization.
Manage periodical business reporting of games, working across multiple teams to identify and present high-level analytics to key-stakeholders and executives.
Collaborate with other analytic teams within the corporation
Recruit and manage analysts if required by the project
Qualifications
Ideally a degree in Analytics / Econometrics OR in related fields like Business / Computer Science / Economics / Information Engineering / Mathematics
Very good communication skills, enjoy communication with other people and an outspoken personality
Very good experience with programming languages (C++, Python, Ruby, Javascript)
Good SQL knowledge required
Ability to work independently and manage a range of parallel projects
Prior experience in analyzing big data with focus on: data viz, data mining and privacy
Knowledge about the games industry market
Knowledge about various business models related to game industry and related industry relevant key performance indicators
Good to advanced knowledge on Statistics, Mathematics, Business and Economics
Experience with frontend / backend web services technologies will give the candidate an edge

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.This is your chance to work on the team that helps Facebooks Platform partners, marketers, and advertisers build engaging social applications based on the Facebook Platform. As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be the first point of contact for bug reports and platform development questions raised by the Facebook Platform developer community. You will assist our developers by providing creative solutions to challenging technical issues, while also working with the internal engineering teams to ensure all issues raised are dealt with in a timely manner. In addition to this you will be responsible for building and improving our internal support tooling and reporting. This is a full-time role based in Singapore.

Responsibilities:

Provide world class support to the Facebook Platform developer community
Become an expert in our products, our developers and their needs by providing effective technical consultation
Manage technical and product issues and escalations, delivering the highest level of developer satisfaction
Help scale developer support with Sales and Partnership growth
Work directly with developers to resolve technical issues
Engage with the operations and engineering teams to build, drive and improve our tools and processes
Write production code that will improve our internal tooling and our external support channels Build product insights from developer experience/sentiments and work with cross-functional partners to take appropriate action
Deliver data-driven, impactful results
Lead projects end-to-end from ideation, design, build, and launch
Build understanding about the wide variety of software across the Platform at a deep engineering level

Bachelors degree in Computer Science or related field (or equivalent degree and experience)
5+ years of experience in software development
Programming abilities in one or more of the following languages: Java, PHP, Objective-C, Python and Ruby
Excellent communication skills in English, particularly written communication
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills
Experience developing for mobile would be an advantage
Preferred Qualifications:

Refinitiv Labs provides a unique opportunity to work in a global company with a culture of a start-up.

As a part of our growing Singapore Lab team of data scientists, engineers and UX/UI designers you will be part of our global network of like-minded colleagues in our sister labs in London and New York.

We are looking for a Fontend Engineer capable of producing scalable software solutions. You will be part of a cross-functional team thats responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to development.

You should have strong experience with front-end coding languages, development frameworks, and third-party libraries. You should also be familiar with visual design and be willing to work with a team.

Responsibilities
Building spectacular Proof of Concepts (POCs) to Beta products for the global Finance and Risk community via design led agile development in partnership with customers
Creating compelling proposals with technologists in partnership with business, driving innovation from conception to production
Analysis, design and implementation of complex software solutions using customer focused design driven methodologies, delivered via public cloud
Defining, organising and implementing projects across multiple locations and time zones
Translating end user needs to requirements using a lightweight agile design led methodology
Building domain expertise in Financial market content and Refinitiv systems.
Networking in the fintech, big data and academic community through conferences, meetups and workshops bringing cutting edge techniques and technology into business strategy

Excellent skills and experience working with front-end JavaScript.
Strong experience with front-end frameworks and libraries, preferably React, Vue or Angular.
Familiarity with web servers, databases and cloud-based services, preferably AWS.
Strong UI/UX design exposure and experience in making apps work intuitively
Critical thinking, value judgment and common sense over process.
Able to work independently as well as in a team.
Positive attitude to learning new skills and technologies.
Diploma / Degree in Information Technology / Computer Science / or equivalent.

Job Description

As an MSB Assembly Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D, SPC, Six Sigma & DMAIC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment
Maintain in-depth process knowledge in DA & WB
Maintain materials and equipment knowledge as it relates to the process and how they interact
Optimize process and/or equipment variables
Identify all process variations and work towards variability control
Apply DOE techniques
Perform containment of process and equipment deviations, process mapping and commonality study
Determine root cause and implement corrective actions & preventive actions
Maintain FMEA, SOP, QCP, OCAP
Evaluate Future Process, Equipment and/or Material Technologies
Evaluate pertinent technology and engineering advancements relating to equipment, materials and processes
Locate and research technical information on equipment, materials, and/or processes in journals, literature, web, etc
Build and maintain effective relationships with suppliers
Identify supplier’s materials or equipment design and production processes
Create decision matrix for equipment and material selection
Develop Process of Record (POR)
Define and document customer requirements
Define process variables
Define process edges and center the process (CPK)
Qualify New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and implement quality systems
Maintain knowledge of Assembly’s qualification procedures
Maintain knowledge of Quality and Reliability Assurance (QRA)
Implement New Process, Equipment and/or Material
Define and maintain operation procedures
Review current procedures on an on-going basis
Maintain knowledge of Assembly On-Line Document System (AODS) and change communication procedures: ECN (Engineering Change Notice)
Assess material requirements and projections
Maintain knowledge of material attributes (shelf life, storage requirements, etc.)
Ensure materials compatibility with equipment and parameters
Maintain knowledge of supplier’s constraints
Maintain knowledge of new chemical/material approval process and MICIS (Micron Chemical Information Systems)
Coordinate Training Requirements and Conduct Training
Develop, or coordinate development of, training materials for existing/new process
Conduct training for production trainers
Train and mentor others
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Electrical/Mechanical/Material Science/ Mechatronics Engineering
Minimum 3 years experience in assembly processes
Fast learner, with initiative and independence (min supervision)
Good team player
Familiar with QC tools, Engineering data & statistics analysis application in manufacturing environment (added advantage)

Job Responsibilities:
Conducts varied & complex chemical and physical laboratory tests involving materials synthesis, processing, characterization and related troubleshooting. Works closely with other engineers & scientists to test new concepts, develop prototype equipment and conduct non-standard experiments.
Plans, tests and sets up equipment and materials needed. Expected to draft proposed design and planning of experiments.
Generates, analyzes and interprets data. Summarizes and interprets results and prepares reports documenting testing process and findings. Uses graphics and statistics as appropriate to convey findings.

Interact with the leadership team to align on goals and provide technical updates.

Broad knowledge of laboratory & pilot plant terminology, equipment, procedures and safety practices.

This role is with Right-Hand Cybersecurity, a startup supported by SGInnovate.

At Right-Hand, our mission is to make humans more defensible against cyber threats. In today’s dynamic and ever evolving threat landscape, cyber attackers possess advanced capabilities to evade traditional technological security layers (like an email security platform or a firewall). This forces the company’s employees to serve as the last line of defense. However, with roughly 90% of cyber attacks occurring due to human error, it is evident that most employees are not prepared for these scenarios. Right-Hand is uniquely positioned to help organisations address this massive issue and reduce human influenced cyber risk.

The Job
As a Software Engineer at Right-Hand, you will be part of our small, agile team that is building and designing our next generation cyber security platform. Working across our stack, you will be responsible for creating end-to-end microservices that support business operations as we scale and grow our client base. Our ideal candidate is an experienced Rails and front-end React developer who thrives in an agile environment and has a passion for developing high-quality, maintainable code using the latest technologies. We are looking for curious, collaborative teammates who are eager to teach what they already know and is excited to take responsibility for large parts of our applications. Your technical judgment and experience will help us build the tools today that will redefine tomorrow’s cybersecurity landscape.

Technologies we use: Rails, Angular, React, Amazon cloud service, Docker/Elastic, AWS Lambda, RSpec

As a Software Engineer, you will:
Write rock solid, well-tested and maintainable code in Rails 5x, React and technology stack we will be adopting down the road
Take full ownership and responsibility for building, shipping, and maintaining core web applications and microservices
Ensure that standards and principles are adhered to and communicated to other stakeholders on the team
Identify performance bottlenecks, use good coding patterns to avoid them in the first place, and optimise existing large-scale complex systems
Participate in code reviews
Keep abreast of relevant technologies, systems, tools, processes, and make recommendations and decisions on inclusion into the Right-Hand development methodologies and product architecture
You bring to the table:
2 - 6 years of experience in Ruby on Rails, ReactJS and NodeJS
Hands-on experience in designing and developing end-to-end applications
Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment
Self-disciplined and pays attention to quality, details, and most importantly, results
You like to share - you write code that is modular and extensible whenever possible and leave code better than you found it
An eager to learn mindset, positive attitude, and an unrivalled level of effort
It’s great, but not required, if you have:
Experience in the Cybersecurity industry
Experience building microservices
Experience building APIs
Knowledge of containerisation and AWS

About AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? As the Facilities worldwide operations and UPW/WWT engineer you will be responsible for providing technical support, expertise, and lead business process alignment on operational and maintenance programs for the facility UPW/WWT systems at all front and back end sites. Job Description

As an MSB Assembly Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D, SPC, Six Sigma & DMAIC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment
Maintain in-depth process knowledge in DA & WB
Maintain materials and equipment knowledge as it relates to the process and how they interact
Optimize process and/or equipment variables
Identify all process variations and work towards variability control
Apply DOE techniques
Perform containment of process and equipment deviations, process mapping and commonality study
Determine root cause and implement corrective actions & preventive actions
Maintain FMEA, SOP, QCP, OCAP

This role is with Right-Hand Cybersecurity, a startup supported by SGInnovate.

At Right-Hand, our mission is to make humans more defensible against cyber threats. In today’s dynamic and ever evolving threat landscape, cyber attackers possess advanced capabilities to evade traditional technological security layers (like an email security platform or a firewall). This forces the company’s employees to serve as the last line of defense. However, with roughly 90% of cyber attacks occurring due to human error, it is evident that most employees are not prepared for these scenarios. Right-Hand is uniquely positioned to help organisations address this massive issue and reduce human influenced cyber risk.

Write rock solid, well-tested and maintainable code in Rails 5x, React and technology stack we will be adopting down the road

Self-disciplined and pays attention to quality, details, and most importantly, results

Job Title: Capacity Planning Engineer ( Fresh graduates are welcome to apply) 1
Job Description:
Req. ID: 146045

Job Description

As a Back End Central Planning Capacity Planning Engineer at Micron Technology, you will engage with Back End Planning and Industrial Engineering teams, Engineering, Factory Network and Supply Chain to optimize Network requirements and drive improvement in business processes. You will be interfacing with internal and external stakeholders to identify resources required to support the plan and follow up on actions to close identified gaps. You will monitor build plans, analyze CTM solves and CSM bucket report to ensure that manufacturing sites have the needed capacity to perform as planned.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Capacity Methods and Integration
Understanding the implications of modeling assumptions in CSM and CTM solves
Audit model assumptions versus actual factory performance and drive gaps closure (Utilization, EPT, load size, lot size, using static and dynamic models)
Influence decision making process to optimize the network capacity to improve supply availability
Able to efficiently perform what-if analysis and provide data driven recommendations
Develop capacity business processes and specify requirements
Drive Benchmarking Process
Work with site IE, MFG and Engineering to understand and close the gaps in workstation performance to meet external benchmark levels
Drive areas to close gaps in performance of tools with in a workstation through internal benchmarking
Headcount model benchmarking
Manage Capital Process
Optimize capital resources by initiating asset transfers in the global network
Collaborate with the sites to minimize capital spending via productivity improvements and optimizing available equipment and tooling
Coordinate capital purchase to meet flex capacity percentages
Monitor adherence to capital cycle and on time funding submissions
Audit tool count to align with MICAP and SIG delivery dates
Participate in Capacity Related Projects
Support systems and tools adoption related to Capacity Planning
Support manufacturing efficiency efforts for the site (cycle time, utilization improvement, constraints management, capacity optimization)
Participate and influence design of capacity systems to convert all planning related assumptions and models
Ensure a Safe, Compliant, and Ethical Work Environment
Comply with company safety, labor, and ethics policies
Participation in mandatory safety trainings
Encourage a culture of safety and contribute to a safe work environment
Provide timely feedback when quality, safety, or ethical issues arise
Follow and support company-wide and department safety procedures to maintain a clean, safe, and accident-free work environment
Promote high integrity processes that will enable immediate sharing of problems, issues and solutions with management team
Requirement
Bachelors Degree in Engineering
Good in written communication and presentation skills
Highly motivated to work in a dynamic environment, with good integrity and character
Ability to multi-task and organize work systematically in meeting deadlines without compromising on quality
Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite applications, etc.
We recruit, hire, train, promote, discipline and provide other conditions of employment without regard to a person's race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, pregnancy, veteran’s status, or other classifications protected under law. This includes providing reasonable accommodation for team members' disabilities or religious beliefs and practices.

Each manager, supervisor and team member is responsible for carrying out this policy. The EEO Administrator in Human Resources is responsible for administration of this policy. The administrator will monitor compliance and is available to answer any questions on EEO matters.

To request assistance with the application process, please contact Micron’s Human Resources Department at 1-800-336-8918 (or 208-368-4748).

Job Title: SVP/ Director, Head of IT Infra Services, Data Center & DevOps
Job Description:
SVP/ Director, Head of IT Infrastructure Services, Data Center & DevOps wanted for a top conglomerate firm!

High profile leadership role
Dynamic and collaborative work culture
Opportunity to work on interesting projects

Our client is a well- known Conglomerate with over 70 years of long standing history and currently has multiple subsidiaries across the business.

As the company is currently undergoing a major digital and infrastructure transformation journey, they are currently looking for a Senior IT leader to lead their overall IT Infrastructure Transformation across the group. Reporting to the Group CIO, you will lead the design and architecture of the IT Infrastructure strategic roadmap for the group. You will be also expected to lead their migration journey from On- prem Data Centres to public cloud environment such as Google Cloud or AWS. You will also lead a team of DevOps Engineers and implement the latest DevOps methodologies and gain buy- in to ensure everyone would follow the best practices.

This is a great opportunity for someone who would like to join a forward thinking company which is looking to change the way they do things digitally to empower both employees and customers.

To qualify, you must have the following:
Holds at least a bachelor's degree in Computer Engineer or other related fields of study
Has at least 15 years of overall IT Infrastructure experience, with at least 7 years of senior leadership experience leading the Infrastructure services & Data Center function
Strong experience in all aspects of Data Centers, including build, migration/ co-location and operations
Deep technical expertise in managing public cloud environment, such as Google Cloud or AWS
Experience with managing DevOps teams and has expertise in DevOps and configuration management tools such as Docker, Kubernetes, Terraform, Jira, Git.
Holding certifications such as ITIL, MSCE etc would be a huge plus
Excellent communication skills with the ability to act as a business partner to engage with senior management and get buy- in from them by influencing them

If you have what it takes, please send your resume to daniel.ong@ambition.com.sg or click APPLY NOW. For more information, please visit www.ambition.com.sg.

About AXA

Would you like to wake up every day driven and inspired by our noble mission and to work together as one global team to empower people to live a better life? Here at AXA we strive to lead the transformation of our industry. We are looking for talented individuals who come from varied backgrounds, think differently and want to be part of this exciting transformation by challenging the status quo so we can push AXA - a leading global brand and one of the most innovative companies in our industry - onto even greater things.

In a fast-evolving world and with a presence in 64 countries, our 165,000 employees and exclusive distributors anticipate change to offer services and solutions tailored to the current and future needs of our 107 million customers.

Our intention is to evolve AXA REV (Research, Engineering & Vision) Singapore to the next level, in alignment with Group Data & Technology Innovation mission to support in transformation journey of AXA in Asia towards tech led company.

OUR PURPOSE

Accelerate innovation cycles (“to go faster from insights to action”) and increase adoption rate of innovation (“to deliver innovation at scale”) in Asia.

Increase entity transformation on data & technology innovation with a stronger collaboration with and in Entities and Group functions (joint ideation, co-creation, seed-funding, advisory, best-practice sharing, community building in data & technology) within Asian Markets and Select International Markets supported by Group Data and Technology Innovation.

Improve innovation scaling through an integrated delivery model with AXA GO Shared Services team in Manila/ KL and strong tech-related external partnerships.

Focus our efforts on the top 10+6 AXA entities, Group functions are well as the transversal business units P&C Commercial (XL/ACS/Art), IM and Group Innovation within Asia.

Be a forward thinker on data & technology and gain credibility and knowledge by combining our hands-on expertise with Group’s research & thought leadership on emerging technologies and its implications in Asia.

What We Offer
At AXA, we lead a an HR policy that encourages diversity, maintains your professional and private life balance and accelerates the skills and career development : promotion of diversity, remuneration policy, training device, ... Discover everything that makes AXA an employer of choice.
Whatever your job is, we strive to offer you career opportunities. Our goal is to develop your skills to support the transformation of our changing business.

Facebook's mission is to give people the power to build community and bring the world closer together. Through our family of apps and services, we're building a different kind of company that connects billions of people around the world, gives them ways to share what matters most to them, and helps bring people closer together. Whether we're creating new products or helping a small business expand its reach, people at Facebook are builders at heart. Our global teams are constantly iterating, solving problems, and working together to empower people around the world to build community and connect in meaningful ways. Together, we can help people build stronger communities - we're just getting started.This is your chance to work on the team that helps Facebooks Platform partners, marketers, and advertisers build engaging social applications based on the Facebook Platform. As a Developer Support Engineer, you will be the first point of contact for bug reports and platform development questions raised by the Facebook Platform developer community. You will assist our developers by providing creative solutions to challenging technical issues, while also working with the internal engineering teams to ensure all issues raised are dealt with in a timely manner. In addition to this you will be responsible for building and improving our internal support tooling and reporting. This is a full-time role based in Singapore.

Deliver data-driven, impactful results
Lead projects end-to-end from ideation, design, build, and launch
Build understanding about the wide variety of software across the Platform at a deep engineering level

Excellent communication skills in English, particularly written communication
Demonstrated creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills
Experience developing for mobile would be an advantage
Preferred Qualifications:

Refinitiv Labs provides a unique opportunity to work in a global company with a culture of a start-up.

As a part of our growing Singapore Lab team of data scientists, engineers and UX/UI designers you will be part of our global network of like-minded colleagues in our sister labs in London and New York.

We are looking for a Fontend Engineer capable of producing scalable software solutions. You will be part of a cross-functional team thats responsible for the full software development life cycle, from conception to development.

Creating compelling proposals with technologists in partnership with business, driving innovation from conception to production

Job Title: Global Facilities - Senior Engineer FCT UPW/WWT
Job Description:
Req. ID: 146261

As the Facilities worldwide operations and UPW/WWT engineer you will be responsible for providing technical support, expertise, and lead business process alignment on operational and maintenance programs for the facility UPW/WWT systems at all front and back end sites. As a global team member residing in your current site/geography, you will represent all facility O&M alignment initiatives. You will also support the design and construction team providing critical operational and maintenance design input and support construction projects as needed.

Critical metrics include eliminating production events that minimize lost moves and scrap.

Responsibilities and tasks:
Expert understanding of each sites UPW/WWT systems operational and maintenance capabilities in order to provide critical support
In addition to your global UPW/WWT engineering role you will also provide site/regional support for global facility initiatives at your location
Technically lead a global cross functional team focused on operational excellence with the site gas systems engineers
Provide support to all sites including on site presence for critical failures
Actively involved in TPM implementation and alignment along with ongoing support for UPW/WWT systems
Drive improvement in the quality of our utilities through variation reduction (SPC).
Drive the alignment for common methodologies including SPC, conformance, SIPP’s, MOC and 8D problem solving throughout the network
Identify and deploy cost reduction efforts while optimizing and reducing energy usage for UPW/WWT systems throughout the network
Assess and insure effective and consistent PM and predictive maintenance programs, procedures and checklists across the network
Regular communication with the site engineering and O&M teams on status and performance
Analyze and benchmark equipment performance.

Job Description

As an MSB Assembly Process Engineer you will be primarily responsible for starting up, developing and optimizing processes to improve product quality and reliability, working on process yield improvement, cost reduction, productivity improvement and risk management as well as resolving manufacturing line problems. You will also be required to identify, diagnose and resolve assembly process related problems by applying failure analysis, FMEA, 8D, SPC, Six Sigma & DMAIC methodology. Additional responsibilities include coordinating and carrying out process, equipment and material evaluation/optimization to implement changes at process step, leading and participating in yield improvement and cost reduction activities, handling new process baseline qualifications and managing, auditing and liaising with material suppliers to achieve quality, cost and risk management objectives.

Responsibilities and Tasks

Evaluate and Improve Assigned Assembly Manufacturing Processes, Materials, and/or Equipment
